title: Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Tennessee City, TN)
Interview Descriptions: Great interview process. The recruiter paid attention to what concerns I had. The process was smooth and realistic. The time frame and communication were exceptional. The hiring process was eye opening.
Interview Questions: How do you handle tough conversations?

title: Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Western Governors University in Jun 2023
Interview Descriptions: After being referred to for the position, I got an email from someone in HR wanting to conduct a phone screening. It went well! It was just me going over my CV. The following week I was able to speak with the hiring manager for the role. It was a video interview. He was nice and we went over the role and my CV in more detail. They were trying to finalize a decision for that week, and I was told I'd hear back but never did. I had to pester them for an additional week just to hear back that I wasn't selected. Oh well!!
Interview Questions: Tell us about your work experience.

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Western Governors University (Murray, UT)
Interview Descriptions: The interviews were set up quickly and I thought everyone I met was very friendly. They all seemed to really enjoy working there and I could see myself getting along with the team.
Interview Questions: They asked me to explain accruals.

title: Part Time Evaluator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: Spoke with the recruiter and didn’t go through to next round. It was a basic interview and was brief.Never heard anything back from them on whether or not I got it
Interview Questions: Tell me about your self

title: Product Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Western Governors University (Salt Lake City, UT)
Interview Descriptions: A lengthly, but, thorough interview process. The interviews included stakeholders from a number of different cross-functional business units, which made scheduling challenging; improvements can be made in streamlining the order in which candidates receive interviews.
Interview Questions: Q: How do you go about handling stakeholders with challenging requests or feedback?

title: Enrollment Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Columbus, OH)
Interview Descriptions: It was thorough, but also comfortable. It was a virtual conference. They were prompt and asked a lot of questions. It felt very easygoing and as though I was apart of the team already. They answered my questions as well.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Program Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: The process was very easy and comfortable. Situational questions asked mostly. The interviewers were very easy to talk too. The interview process was fast as well. Interviewed and received a offer within a week or so.
Interview Questions: Tell me how would you organize your priorities within the needs of the students

title: Staff Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with HR. They asked general questions regarding experience ,explained the position and gave a company overview. Was moved on to the next round and interviewed with the entire team of accountants. It was the manager and 3 others people. Each person asked questions regarding my experience and other behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had to make a difficult decision?

title: Evaluator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Western Governors University in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: After applying, I received an email two days later asking for an initial interview with the HR Recruiter. I had my initial interview with HR the following day. The recruiter was fantastic and was a joy to speak with. Two days later I had a single interview with the hiring manager and an additional person. This was also a calm interview and more like a conversation. In total, the process took eight days from submitting my application to receiving a job offer.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for WGU?

title: Regulatory Affairs Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: Had one interview with recruiter. They asked basic questions and the interview lasted about 30 minutes. The questions largely focused on why I was interested in the position and my background. They provided some information about the position and the department. Received a rejection a few weeks later.
Interview Questions: What are you interested in the position?

title: Part Time Evaluator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: The interview involved three steps: A phone interview with a recruiter, an interview with the supervisors/managers, and a final interview. The interview with the recruiter was the easiest, and the process made me feel at ease. I think it helped that I studied the university's website and mission, and went over the interview process information presented on WGU's website. I was asked basic questions about who I am, my education and job experience, why I wanted to work for WGU, and what experiences I have that would make a fit for the university. I made it to the second interview where you get asked some of the same questions above as well as situational questions about how you would handle different problems or how you've handled them in the past. This part of the interview is harder because you must adhere to the STAR method for answering questions, so please study it! It's important! The final interview involved the job offer and expectations. This was easy.
Interview Questions: Q. Tell us about yourself. Q. Why are you interested in working for WGU? Q. Describe a time where you had to overcome a technology issue. Q. Describe a time you didn't agree with an instruction at work and how you handled the situation.

title: Evaluator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: Virtual Screener that was in depth - 30 minutes Panel Interview in depth - 30 minutes Both were grueling with the depth of questions and required response format of STAR. It is unnatural to answer in a format.
Interview Questions: Everything was in the STAR response format. Seemed super promising until I realized they weight responses more for STAR format than your ability and background.

title: Course Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: The initial interview with HR was so fantastic that I tried to convince myself that faculty are more than a call center. After that the whole thing was just awkward. Manager at second interview was pompous and impersonal. Other instructor didn’t speak to me unless I spoke to her. Bullet dodged.
Interview Questions: How would you respond to a student who needs help getting started on a rhetorical analysis.

title: Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: First round was a two-interviewer panel with one manager and one research analyst colleague, which mostly focused on BQ and previous higher education related experience. Second round was with VP. The third round suppose to be an on-site interview (in their headquarter) with more technical oriented tasks. Overall, it was very nice and enjoyable interview experience, I do enjoy the discussion about higher education and data analysis, and appreciate their flexibility of working time for people working from different time zones.
Interview Questions: Describe one of the projects that you have been proud of. Describe the procedure of dealing with educational data.

title: Alumni Relations Liaison Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Western Governors University in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with the recruiter initially. Simple easy questions and informed me about the process, job, and benefits. Had a second interview with the hiring manager that went more in-depth and asked more questions that pertained to the role. Then had a third interview with the regional Vice President of the Northeast region. After that, I had a fourth and final interview with two other individuals that asked me more high-level questions. After all of that I was ignored and never reached back out to. The process took almost 2 months of wasted time and felt like nobody seemed to care about getting back to me about the position. Seems I was just dragged along to meet their quota of amount of people needed to interview for the job. Wouldn’t recommend applying here.
Interview Questions: Most questions dealt with the position or getting to know me as a person.

title: Enrollment Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: *They will ask you about an experience using the STAR method *Skills that align with the position * They will ask about your experience with Metrics and how you used it
Interview Questions: STAR method Skills that align with the position Metrics knowledge

title: Adjunct Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Applied, phone call with recruiter, then phone call with team members. Questions were simple and easy. Said I would hear in 2 weeks. I never heard back from them. I followed up, but did not hear back.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest weakness?

title: Benefits Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: I put my application in a got called 3 days later. I completed the second interview and was advised that I’ll know by the end of the week. That was 2 1/2 months ago with no reply. I have reached out multiple times for an update. Extremely unprofessional would not waste your time.
Interview Questions: What is your background in benefits

title: Program Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Lawton, OK) in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: Video call with one manager. Went over resume. Answered a bunch of “tell me about a time you struggled, how would you help a student not making progress…” Was allowed to ask questions. Was told that the interview was recorded so other managers could watch and make recommendations. Might take a few weeks to hear back due to the holidays.
Interview Questions: Use one minute and tell me about yourself.

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: The first interview was a phone call, pretty easy. The second was with two people and easy. I thought it went well but I did not get an offer. Both interviews were them reading off a script which I thought was weird.
Interview Questions: What technology do you use?

title: Program Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Cincinnati, OH) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: There are at least two interviews. One is a screening interview with a recruiter. The second one is with hiring manager. Each interview has a lot of behavioral behavioral questions. Not a lot of feedback during the interview.
Interview Questions: What is your Greatest Weakness

title: full time evaluator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Salt Lake City, UT) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: The entire process took 4-6 weeks. Starts with a phone screening interview approx 30-45 minutes with recruiting officer. Had to complete a writing sample answering some questions and also a sample evaluation using rubric and providing feedback. Follow online (Microsoft Teams) meeting with manager and supervisor (45 min - 1 hour). All was very positive. The people were great!
Interview Questions: Multiple behavioral questions (scenario type) that they read from a guide. I'm guessing they do this to keep things consistent and fair from one candidate interview to the next. (Ex: Describe a time you were unable to follow through on something.)

title: HR role Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Phone screen with a recruiter which lasted about an hour.

Feedback: initial outreach was prompt and positive. Recruiter advised timeline on when would get back and never did. Even after reaching out to recruiter (twice) still took a while for a response. After a few weeks, got a blanket decline email.  Not really professional to just send a generated email after a phone conversation without providing feedback. Also, process was slow and no follow-up. Recommend you honor your
Timeline with your candidates and provide actual feedback if candidate advances beyond a resume review if you are going to decline. Feedback is critical to help candidates know what to do better.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your background and experience?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: Easy, about a week in between screener and interview. The first interview was her reading off a screen, but the second was more personal. I am not sure if there is a third
Interview Questions: To give specific examples of their questions

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions:
A few steps in the process: HR screening, hiring manager + team member interview, team member interview, senior management interview. 

Everyone was very nice on the interviews and did a great job explaining the role and university. They asked insightful questions that seemed to be relevant to the role I was applying for.
Interview Questions: Explain the difference between UNION and UNION ALL

title: Evaluator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: Had a phone interview which went well. The questions were much what I expected. They said I would be emailed a written prompt I had a few days to do and send back. After I completed this they would schedule a second interview. The pay was much much lower than I expected. I actually thought they were joking at first. I have 3 years of educational teaching experience at the university level and was offered $22 an hour.
Interview Questions: How did you hear about the position

title: Enrollment Counselor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: 30 minute phone interview first, then 45 minute virtual interview, both conducted by one person. Interviewers were very personable and it was obvious they endeavored to make the interview conversation engaging and comfortable.
Interview Questions: Why would you be a good fit for this role? How have you effectively communicated to put a coworker at ease?

title: Sr. Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: Virtual meeting with recruiter, followed a week or so later with hiring manager. Several weeks later had 3 peer type interviews. It was very slow between each step, and final decision.
Interview Questions: Describe your style as a manager

title: Student Support Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process included three separate interviews. One was over the phone with recruitment and the second two were with the direct supervisor for the position. Questions included how do you feel working remotely, how to handle disagreements with coworkers, and what your overall career goal is- including many other questions.
Interview Questions: What single word comes to mind when you think of WGU?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: First interview seemed to go well. Recruiter was personable and helpful with information about the position. Asked about past roles. Salary range was fair for the position and the university appears to be a positive work environment. Was disappointed when I didn't hear anything back.
Interview Questions: What types of projects have you worked on and what type of documentation do you use?

title: Enrollment Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions:
Very professional and comfortable conversation.
Questions were relevant to position.  Interviewer acknowledged responses and sometimes made personal comments afterwards. No trick questions.  Interviewer seemed genuinely interested in me and what I had to say.
Interview Questions: Tell me how your skill set will help you in this position.

title: Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: I applied for a couple of positions online (Jobs A and B).  A recruiter emailed me that I had a screening with her for position C (for which I had not applied). I reviewed the listing online and since I had relevant experience, figured they looked over my resume and were interested in me for that job.  When I entered the online meeting with the recruiter, she told me I was being considered for Job D, which was the same level as Job B which I had applied for but was in a different department. I had a lot of questions which made me look like a total idiot. In fact, she condescendingly told me I should know what job I applied for (I did, but it wasn't what she emailed me about nor referred to in the call/ meeting). I was never referred on for an interview with the hiring manager, which wasn't a surprise since I was so confused in the screening call. This probably worked out for the best anyway since they were offering me about a 17k pay cut.
Interview Questions: What questions do you have about this position?

title: Admissions Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Pensacola, FL) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: *Apply online * Phone interview with a  description with a recruiter* Zoom/Teams interview with the hiring manager. During the interview with the hiring manager she will ask you questions and tell you about herself. Then they offer you the position in the interview with the salary requirement.
Interview Questions:
1.Tell me about a time you had an upset person and how did you get through it?
2. What drew you to the job?
3. Tell me about you.
4. When can you start?

title: Business Intelligence Analyst Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Very disappointed in WGU. Interview process took about a
month with 3 interviews and a work sample. Brief phone
interview with HR, followed by video interview with Hiring
Manager, then the last interview with 2 team members. After
the last interview I submitted a work sample demonstrating
Tableau and SQL skills.

I was told to expect a response from either HR or the hiring
manager within several days. Nothing after 3 days, nothing
after a week, so I followed up for an update, no response. After
all that time wasted just to get ghosted is frustrating and very
unprofessional. At least have the decency to formally reject
someone if they don't qualify.

Absolutely would not recommend anyone interviewing here. Waste of time and the hiring staff don’t respect your time.
Interview Questions: List types of window functions and provide and example of how to use them

title: Senior Manager, Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Very thorough process - clearly organized and with a lot of structure behind it. The recruiter I worked with (Tyler) was fantastic - very responsive and helpful throughout, and most scheduling and communication happened through him via phone calls, not email, which is uncommon in my experience but goes to show you the personal approach they take to hiring. 

The sequence of interviews made sense. Recruiter, hiring manager, extended team, VPs, SVP. From beginning to end everyone was very disarming and friendly, but at the same time, you can tell they take their hiring process quite seriously to weed out folks who might not be an ideal fit. I'd say the questions were tough in the sense that everyone wants to hire the best people, but they were fair and totally appropriate given the seniority of the role. 

I ended up declining the role for another opportunity but it was a very, very difficult decision since everyone I met with was so genuine and warm - and they very clearly have their act together as an organization.
Interview Questions:
- How would you onboard yourself to this position? 
- How do you manage your team/s? 
- When required, how do you managing competing priorities?

title: Content Writer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pleasant and fairly quick! I had an initial interview with HR, followed by two interviews with different sets of people. It all happened within two weeks.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stress?

title: Evaluator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Coolidge, AZ) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: Applied and did a phone screening with recruiter. Then met with Team lead and supervisor absolutely amazing interview. Then interviewed with hiring manager who was the rudest person I have ever met. Refused to answer my questions, was rude and short and just plain disrespectful. I’ve asked for feedback from recruiter and have been ghosted. After three interviews not even being told they went with someone else is so unprofessional. After two amazing interviews the hiring manager really dropped the ball on the culture WGU claims is important to them.
Interview Questions: Explain a time you had to learn something new.

title: Product Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Western Governors University in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: Over a four month period: - Applied online and had an initial screen with a WGU recruiter. - First interview was with a peer Product Manager. - Second interview was with the Development Manager. - Third interview was a panel with Design and UX. - Fourth interview was with a Director. - Fifth interview was with a Manager. The time between each interview so waited a few weeks to reach out to the recruiter who is no longer responding to emails. Feedback was positive during the interview process, really liked everyone I spoke to, bought into their mission, and felt like there's good work to be done so was considering a significant pay cut ($20k) but to invest four months in a recruitment and then not have the basic decency to respond is really odd.
Interview Questions: How do you manage competing priorities? What teams do you work with? What is your experience with agile?

title: Evaluator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: I had to complete a task to get to the interview process. Next, I went through several phone conferences and team/zoom meetings. Then no communication. I had to follow up with them.
Interview Questions: Something I am proud of in my career

title: Visual Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: I'm not sure when I applied, but from when they reached out for an interview to accepting an offer was about 2 months. 1 month after the screening interview, I had my second interview. I had 4 interviews total.  My initial interview with the HR person was very informational and  I just enjoyed talking with him. His first question was "What questions do you have for me?" This interview was recorded and sent to the supervisor of this position. We had a good talk but since most of the "hard" questions were asked in the initial interview it felt like the rest of the interviews were pretty casual. I did pull up my portfolio in the 2nd interview and we talked a bit about my work. All of the interviews were conducted remotely for this job. All-in-all a GREAT interview experience!
Interview Questions: What questions do you have for me?

title: Program Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Salt Lake City, UT) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: I was apprehensive about interviewing for the position.  Honestly because of my extensive Cyber background I thought I was too experienced for the position.  Most with my background can walk into a position for easily $120k a year.  This job requires a master's degree, Cyber/IT experiences but Caps at $60k lol.  Honestly the job is more suitable for a HR person with some form of college education background.  I don't know not one IT/Cyber person who would accept that amount of money per year.  I work full time and the position is fully time, so I am not a good fit.  But this school is really unrealistic in keeping employees who will love what they do and enjoy the money.  Oh, and they require you to add 10 hours onto your 40 hours and be available for to students after 5pm.  No work life balance nor compensation.
Interview Questions: Star method questions research star interview that grades behavior answers.

title: Product Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University (New York, NY) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: Spent almost 7 weeks in interviews, including a 90-minute tag team where I had to present for the first 15-20 minutes. This was supposedly to make it easier for them to come to a decision — five days later they told me they were not ready to make a decision, so I should accept the offer I’d received for a different company. Recruiters VERY disorganized.
Interview Questions: Give a 15-20 minute presentation on a product you have worked on, or in the form of a pitch for something new

title: Program Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is typical as I find that most organizations do not understand the value offering of an individual. Having performed the role of Marketing Professor with another university in 14 online Higher Ed courses, I would unequivocally be fully able to dupicate the skill set.
Interview Questions: Explain a particular role that is directly transferrable to the Program Mentor role.

title: Program Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Salt Lake City, UT) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: 3 rounds of Interviews- however, not as bad as it may sound. You speak with a hiring manager to start, then meet with the individuals in your department, then you are sent to talk to someone in upper management. The 2nd round interview is the hardest one. 1st and 3rd interviews are more informal and just checking to see that you would be a good fit for the role.
Interview Questions: How would you respond if you found out that you gave a student a piece of information that was unknowingly false?

title: Program Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was a virtual video interview with a program manager. It was a very casual feel with conversations rather than being drilled with questions. The program manager was very personable and easy to talk to.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a problem with a coworker that you have experienced. How did you resolve it? What experience do you have that is valuable to future educators?

title: Lead Instructional Designer - Standards & Practice Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Step 1: Phone interview with a recruiter. I loved this interview; it felt more like a conversation, and I clicked with the recruiter. At the end of the conversation, I was told that I was going to progress to the next stage. I needed to have a link to a portfolio. I was very impressed by and it was respectable that the recruiter was 100% transparent about the salary range for the position! $85-99k. 

Step 2: 1:1 interview with the Director via MS Teams. This interview was the polar opposite of the first. Stuffy, awkward, and somewhat intimidating. The interviewer was nice enough, but I gained the perspective immediately that he was not looking for someone like me. It didn't help his camera shook and wobbled the entire time. When I referenced my portfolio, I felt he never looked at it. He never asked anything about my design experience or projects I completed.
Interview Questions:
Experience or knowledge of competency-based education. 
Tell me about your yourself
Where do you see the future of instructional design? 
What are we doing wrong in education? 
How do you work with cross-functional teams? How do you get the attention from busy members of other teams?

title: Senior Finance Business Partner/Financial Analyst (FP&A) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: Spoke with a recruiter - an interview was set up. I was not given any idea as to who I would be meeting. Interview ended up being with 3 different managers - who each needed a analyst on their team.  From there I was asked to submit some work product. I went above and gave them a variety of items. I then met with their senior manager. Asked about next steps was told that I should know one way or the other by the end of the week. Was ghosted, with no follow-up or communication. They didn't even update their career site on workday.
Interview Questions: On a scale of 1 - 10, how would you rate your love of chaos. Such as 1 your day is consistent, you know what you are doing and can plan. 10 being nothing is the same everyday.

title: Accounting Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Overland, MO) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Straight forward process with two interviews. The first was with HR to verify my qualifications. The second was with team lead/manager. Both people were fantastic and I really enjoyed our conversations. 
Unfortunately, WGU ghosted me.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had to give someone bad news and how you approach that?  (I’m paraphrasing).

title: Program Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Kansas City, KS) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Quick interview with HR rep to describe role and requirements.  2nd Interview with hiring team asking
mostly situational questions ...  "How would you handle a student who ...."   or "Give an example where you ....."
Interview Questions: Q: How would you handle an unmotivated student?

title: Partner Solutions Executive Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions:
I met with the recruiter that reviewed my resume and application.  Pretty standard screening interview.  He then scheduled me to met with the department lead.  Again, pretty standard interview questions.  A third interview was scheduled with the two team members from the department.  Questions were similar - why are you interested, a number of behavioral based questions to assess fit with team.  The three interviews took place within the span of about 5 weeks. 

After that, radio silence.  I reached out to the recruiter and was told the position had changed and was taking longer than expected to fill, that they would be in touch with next steps.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working for WGU?

title: Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: 3 days after I applied was contacted by a recruiter, then by a team, then an offer was provided via phone. The process was friendly, fair and fast. The offer was part time though.
Interview Questions: What do you know about WGU?

title: Field Placement Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: Main/final interview was virtual with 6 people on the panel. They each took turns asking questions. Some were welcoming and friendly, others more serious. It began with a brief 15 minute screening call with a recruiter about a week earlier. After the panel interview, I never heard anything else either way even though I was told they would make their decision within the week. I even called to check on the status and was told they would check and get back to me. Never heard from them again.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you'd be a good fit for this position?

title: Data Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: A recruiter reached out to me saying I looked like an ideal candidate, scheduled a call, and then stood me up. It was super annoying because I moved meetings around to make time for this call.
Interview Questions: I didn't have an interview

title: UX Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: I spoke to an HR person who was really nice. They passed my resume on to the UX team who decided whether to move forward or not (they decided not).
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Vice President Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: I met with 6-7 individuals from across the University.  The interview process also allowed me to interview them and get a better understanding of the organization from various leaders/perspectives.  It appears that the hiring decision is made by this same committee as a vote to hire or not.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at WGU?

title: Data Scientist II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Western Governors University in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: There were two rounds. One with a recruiter and one with a hiring manager then offer. There was no technical assessment. The interviewer was kind and encouraging. I failed in the first round and could not see the second. Questions were about past experiences and primarily behavioral.
Interview Questions: Q1: Tell me about yourself.

title: Program Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was fairly easy. The recruiter and hiring manager were both friendly and engaging. They asked a lot of questions and I did not feel rushed to answer these questions. Meetings provided descriptive explanations of the position's expectation and the timeline to hire.
Interview Questions: How do you handle conflict?

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: After applying the position, I received an email inviting the first round interview with Human Resources. It was a video conference for 30 min. The interview was casual, asking some expected questions, some are not.
Interview Questions:
How do you know about the university?
Tell about teaching experiences you have.

title: Enrollment Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Salt Lake City, UT)
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview process- good questions asked - very helpful and insightful. I found it better than what I thought it would be . Hiring process was fast but thorough and efficient.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you failed?

title: Part Time Teaching Role Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Norfolk, VA) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: Was emailed that I was selected and asked to select dates of availability for said interview. No response for days. Then, I received an email that they had selected someone else. After reading their reviews I am actually glad that that this happened. The real reviews are terrible - high turnover and long time employees were all consistent in their negative reviews. I will NEVER apply for another job at WGU.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Associate Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: There was an initial phone screen with HR, a second round zoom call with the hiring manager and a final panel interview where they ask basic OOP principles and java questions.
Interview Questions: What are the types of exceptions in java?

title: Enrollment Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was divided into two steps. The first step was primarily a screening interview and seemed to gauge whether or not the applicant would be a good culture fit for the university. The second interview dug more into qualifications.
Interview Questions: I was asked about my understanding of WGU's competency-based approach.

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with recruiter followed by a 1:1 interview with manager, then team setting followed by senior leader. It was a lot of interviews over the course of about 3-4 weeks.
Interview Questions: Regarding values around education and how it serves you in life

title: Senior Accountant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: It was a very smooth and quick process. There was no waiting for any information. I was kept up to date on entire process. I was given the information that I would need to have and what was to be expected during the interview.
Interview Questions: Why was I leaving my previous position.

title: Student Success Coach Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: Meet with the recruiter and a panel interview with a demonstration. I was asked to reach out on a coaching competency.  I was also asked to demonstrate Zoom.  The presentation was 10 minutes.
Interview Questions: How do you shop at a grocery store?

title: Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and talked to a recruiter a few times via e-mail and phone. The recruiter was very friendly. Met with a team member and had a good conversation. Did a take home assessment and met with the rest of the team. The team seemed to enjoy the presentation. Unfortunately, no feedback or difficult questions were asked.
Interview Questions: Have you dealt with a difficult situation where you didn't know what to do and how did you approach it?

title: Program Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions:
First, a phone call to set up taped video response to 2-3 questions. You may ask for parts of the taped response to be re-recorded if you stumble through a sentence or phrase.
A followup live video interview is scheduled afterwards.
Interview Questions: What led you to this point in to apply for this position

title: Senior Enrollment Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Mesa, AZ) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: Easy and super personable. I really appreciate the sense of urgency they had getting in contact with me, interview process was very simple. Everyone I had contact was very passionate, professional, and kind. Thank you!
Interview Questions: Behavioral interview. Star based questions

title: Instructional Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: The process was pretty standard for a virtual position, (phone screen, followed by two rounds of virtual interviewing) but one of the interviews was conducted with video on my end, but not the interviewer's. I forget her reasoning, but if you aren't able to appear on video as well, either switch it to a phone interview or reschedule.
Interview Questions: How do you manage difficult personalities?

title: Program Mentor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview first and then 3 weeks later I had a webcam interview. The interview wasn't hard but it took well over a month to find out I did not get it.
Interview Questions: Have you mentored in your previous job?

title: Communications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: It was very lengthy, but the actual interviews were great. Friendly people, easy process. Only negative was the overall timeline of events. Took about a month from first contact to receiving an offer.
Interview Questions: What drives you as a professional

title: Enrollment Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Austin, TX) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: My process consisted of two interviews. A phone interview that lasted about 45 minutes (although typically they are 20-30 minutes) with a Recruiting Partner and a second video interview with a hiring manager which lasted about 30 minutes and ended with a job offer.
Interview Questions:
What do you know of WGU's competency based education system?
What did you do in a work situation where you and a coworker had a disagreement?
Tell us a bit about yourself
Tell us about your experience with WGU
How would you break some bad news to a student that your have been assisting?
 How have you handled difficult changes in your past positions?

title: Instructional Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Chicago, IL) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: Three rounds of interviews were held. The first was with Human Resources,  then the Instructional Design manager, then the Senior Manager. Each interview was about an hour. Pretty straight forward process. People were nice
Interview Questions:
Describe an experience with challenging SME.
What interests you about the role?
Why do you want to leave your current position?
What are your strengths?
What are your future goal?

title: Course Instructor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: A very negative process. Got an email from a recruiter to schedule an initial phone interview then before even getting a chance to have that interview, I received an automated rejection email in 2 days. Reached out to the recruiter about it and she was very unresponsive until she finally replied and said the position has been filled. Not sure what kind of practice you guys are employing during your hiring process to reach out to someone to schedule an interview and send an automated rejection email in 2 days without even doing the interview.  I probably won't pursue any opportunities with your organization in the future. Please be mindful of applicants' time.
Interview Questions: Give a call to further discuss this opportunity with you

title: Evaluator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: It was a phone interview which is not always preferred but the talent acquisition specialist was nice. She explained the details about the position, asked a few questions, then explained the benefits of working for WGU. After that it was question time for me.
Interview Questions: Explain a conversation in which you were offered constructive advice.

title: Strategic Partnership Manager (ATL) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Atlanta, GA) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions:
I received one phone interview with a talent agent and
one  skype interview with hiring  manager one hour process each. Second interview was a conversational back ground discussion in which I believed I did well but did not make it to the third  panel interview.
Interview Questions: How do you handle complex work initiatives?

title: Placement Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of a 30 minute video call interview with the team manager then once passed to the second round of interviews, a 30 minute video call interview with the senior manager. Both interviews had very similar behavior based questions.
Interview Questions: Why should I hire you over other applicants?

title: Faculty Member Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: Was told I would interview with three people. Each person called to set up their calls individually, so I was operating a bit in the dark. After I thought I was complete with the calls, a fourth person called me to set up an interview.  I was informed that the hiring manager would let me know the outcome. Three weeks after the fourth interview, I emailed my HR contact to find out if a decision had been reached.  A week later, I followed up with a phone call. A couple weeks after the that, I received an auto-generated message from the HR system that the position had been filled.
Interview Questions: I was asked about my teaching philosophy.

title: Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: Interview was disorganized. Panel of 3 interviewers asked questions that were not effective at understanding my background or experience. Questions were specific to themselves. They also seemed standoffish and cold.  Did not get a good vibe or a friendly tone from anyone.  I opted to not have second interview. They also wanted me to sign a non-compete clause and do no outside work of any kind. Really?  Not support my family with outside work? Silly. No thanks.
Interview Questions: Questions were not good. Poor interview.

title: Sr. Human Resources Generalist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: Initial screening by talent recruitment, then video interview by hiring manager, then interview by Director of Department, and Chancellor/VP.  Finally, a final interview and offer from Hiring Manager. Great process that focused on skills, interpersonal abilities and communication.
Interview Questions: Most questions were regarding hypothetical situations and potential ways to evaluate and develop solutions.

title: Strategic Partner Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: Great experience. They really tried to get to know me and my strengths. It was a genuine process. I enjoyed all of the interviews. There were three interviews total. First with the hiring manager, second with a peer and the final with the Chancellor and my soon to be boss.
Interview Questions: I don’t remember any of the questions.

title: Program Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Salt Lake City, UT)
Interview Descriptions: 1 screening interview and one more in depth interview usually with 2 or more people in a panel format. Interview changes depending on department  and it lasts around 30 min
Interview Questions: How would I mentor an unmotivated student.

title: Course Instructor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: From my first interview, I had probably THE BEST communication with the initial Talent Coordinator.  She was beyond helpful, friendly, and felt like she was genuinely listening to everything that I said.  I got the chance to meet my future team, and they were some of the most down-to-earth, amazing people.  Everything went smoothly, good questions were asked, and things were explained in great detail.  I haven't had a better interview experience after years of interviewing!
Interview Questions: Q: Discuss a time in your career that you had to do a 180 and change the way you previously did something.

title: Evaluator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: Tedious.  3 rounds.  Not the most organized situation or interview process.  They actually sent me a rejection email and then the next day said that was a mistake and I moved onto the 3 round.
Interview Questions:
STAR
It seems they don't really look for the quality of the responses but rather if you follow the STAR format when responding.

title: IT Site Support Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: Was fairly quick and easy, had a phone interview and one in person with two supervisors. I received an offer about a week later and I started quickly after that
Interview Questions: They explained to me a problem and asked me to troubleshoot it using a computer they had brought to the interview where they intentionally broke it for me to fix to demonstrate my skills

title: Senior Leadership Role Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Sandy, UT) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Many interviews with peers after initial screening (a good thing).  Lack of interest and behaviors (e.g., showed up late, kept looking at clock on wall, yawned during interview, asked same questions across interviewers) indicated most were on a forced march and going through the motions.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this job, why now?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Salt Lake City, UT) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: First, there was a phone interview with recruiter. Additional separate interviews with hiring manager and a member of the team within a week. Decision was made after about 2 weeks.
Interview Questions: What types of projects have you worked on?

title: Business Transformation Project Manager II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: Applied to this opening via WGU website. I received a notification the very next day staying that they have move forward with other candidates. However, a received a separate email from recruiter that although they have move forward with other candidates, they will consider me for further opportunities. I thought this was very professional and more personal. Some companies either send you a generic response or none at all.  Thumbs up WGU.
Interview Questions: Didn't get to the interview process.

title: Evaluator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by a recruiter on a Thursday via email asking for my availability for an interview, which was set for the next day. The interview with the recruiter went really well and she did a great job of making me feel comfortable. She told me that she would forward my information to the hiring manager at the end of our interview and that if they were interested, they would be in touch. A few hours later, I was contacted by the hiring manager, and we set up an interview for the following Monday. The interview was a phone interview and there were three people present. The interview lasted approximately 45 minutes, but the time went by very fast.  It was overall a very good experience.
Interview Questions:
What do you know about WGU?
What do you know about competency-based learning?
What is the difference between competency-based learning and standard evaluation?
Tell us about a time you had to learn something new in a short period of time.

title: Field Placement Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: Video interview.  Questions were based on time management, communication skills.  Stress management was also a big part of the process.  Working as a team and working online with a fast internet speed.
Interview Questions: Tell about a time you had to multi-task with several different matters and all were top priority.

title: Information Security Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Salt Lake City, UT) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: First phone interview was with person from human resources. This was mainly to determine "fit" as well as salary expectations. Then there were two video interviews with manager and tech teams. Second two were fairly technical.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your home IT system

title: Field Placement Coordinator II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Philadelphia, PA) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: I applied on LinkedIn. Recruiter reached out to schedule a video interview. Video interview including situational/behavioral questions as well as questions asking about experience, future career goals, etc. The Recruiter recorded the answers to the questions for the Managers/Supervisors of Field Placement to review so they can make the decision to proceed or not. A couple of days later I was asked to do another video interview on 8/18 with the Superiors in Field Placement. The video interview consisted of 3 to 4 interviewers. Three asked questions, while the other was in and out just observing. All of the questions were situational/behavioral questions, some similar to the ones asked in the interview with the recruiter. The interviewers were quite nice and it was better experience than I thought it would be. They even ended the interview asking me about interests/hobbies. They seemed nice. Well, time goes on and I didn’t hear from them. Then on 9/1, one of the managers asked could I do a second interview with them on the 3rd. That interview comes and it was the same type of  questions as before. Even harder. I simply didn’t understand why I had to go through three rounds of situational/behavioral questions especially when so many are similar. And I don’t do well with these type of questions. Anyway, they stated they would make a decision a week later. But, here it is three weeks later and they still did not bother to give me a courtesy rejection email or call. Browsing through LinkedIn, I did see that they made a decision. Congratulations to the new hire!
Interview Questions: What’s your biggest work failure and who was at fault?

title: Student Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Salt Lake City, UT) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: Had a video conference interview. The woman heading the interview was very professional and friendly.  She made me feel comfortable right from the start. The interview was scheduled online, and I was able to choose a day and time that worked best for me. Overall it was a good experience.
Interview Questions: Past Job Experience, what interested you in the position, and salary expectations

title: Data Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: First interview was with a recruiter. Then an interview with hiring manager where he asked more technical questions. After that I interviewed with three team members which were more of a culture fit assessment. Then a final interview with the hiring manager the next day, but I wasn't sure what the purpose of that interview was.
Interview Questions: They had a specific problem they were trying to solve, so the hiring manager asked how I would approach it. Before a later interview I had time to prepare more thoughts on possible solutions to this problem.

title: Course Instructor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: They reached out via email to schedule the interview. The process was easy to navigate and efficient. The interviewer was very understanding and personable. They were very professional and provided timely feedback.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Corporate Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Salt Lake City, UT) in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions:
STAR Interview questions. Very professional interview with open ended questions. Zoom Interview. Enjoyed and was impressed by interview format.
You'll have to put some time and energy in research and STAR responses. It's a challenging interview, but well worth the time. This is a fantastic company, so they expect a knowledge driven interview.
Interview Questions: Have you worked with ROI and HR Metrics?

title: Evaluator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: The process took 1 week. After applying I was sent a request to interview with an HR rep and after confirming, I was sent a request to complete a writing sample. After that I had an interview with an HR rep first, and was asked a few questions about my experience and why I wanted to work at WGU.  After that interview I was told that I would be contacted by the hiring manager, and I was. That interview was a couple of days later and was more behavioral questions. After that interview I was sent another homework assignment for the interview. The next day I was offered the job.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself and why you would be a good fit at WGU.

title: Project Specialist Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Salt Lake City, UT) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions:
I received an invitation for a phone call with a recruiter shortly after applying. I scheduled a time slot, and I received email reminders before my phone call with Tyson. Tyson asked me some typical questions about my  work history, why I wanted the job, and situational questions. 

A couple days later, I received an auto reject email from WGU. Tyson emailed me personally within minutes to apologize that the role had been filled much more quickly than he anticipated. It seemed maybe communication between him and the specific hiring manager got mixed up somewhere. I only wanted to write this review to commend Tyson for his kindness and consideration, as many other companies will ghost you completely. I had another company where I had reached out to the recruiter via email, and the person just sent me an auto reject rather than responding to me personally. I think it says a lot about a company that can treat people with respect and kindness.
Interview Questions: Walk me through your work history

title: Evaluator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Western Governors University in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: The process took 1 week. I was contacted by a rep from HR requesting an interview. After accepting I was sent a writing sample to complete. After the 1:1 interview  with that rep, the hiring manager contacted me requesting an interview. After that interview I was sent another email with homework to complete. After that was reviewed I was offered the position. Great experience. Very friendly employees.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself and why you would be a good fit at WGU.

title: Program Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: The interview was conducted remotely, which made sense for a remote position. It lasted about 45 minutes and most of the questions were pretty standard. For the situational questions, though, they did want them answered in a very specific way. I think it was situation/action/outcome or something like that and it felt like they wanted a formulaic answer. That was strange to adjust to and reminded me of how they grade you as a student, where your content could be fine but it needed to start with “the situation was...” or else it was “wrong.” That felt really unnatural but otherwise it was fine.
Interview Questions: Why are you applying for this job?

title: Program Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: Common interview questions were asked, it was a  face to face meeting, salary of 51,000/annually, travel once per year about 5 days in October, home office required, and we discussed the equipment the university supplies
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a mentor?

title: IT Service Desk Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Millcreek, UT) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: The process took about 1-2 weeks. There was a preliminary phone interview just going over experience and the details of the job. Also, questions regarding handling challenging experiences. (HR type questions). Then there was an in-person interview with the IT team and it was more technical in questions but pretty simple if you have an A+ cert you'll do fine. For sure be okay with customer service stuff and be passionate about computers.
Interview Questions: What is DNS in laymen's terms?

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Salt Lake City, UT) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: The first call was with a recruiter who then passed my information off to a director within the department. Within a day I had a call to set up a phone call with the director, who by the end of the call had already stayed they wanted me to come in and interview face to face. That's when things slowed down a bit. It took three days before I heard back to schedule the face to face interviews. The interviews went well. A bit unorganized or a lack of communication as to who was planning on being in the interviews, but overall they went well. Things after that slowed down dramatically. I was told a decision was to be made the beginning the following week. That Monday came and went. By midweek I reached out, but didn't get a reply back for a couple more days and I again was they had interest in me still, but were conducting more interviews and it would be the beginning of next week, but also makes me for my references. The next day a director in the department emailed asking if I would supply references. Apparently the recruiter hadn't let the director know I had already supplied them. The beginning of the following week comes and goes and reach out again. Several days pass until I get a reply on a Saturday that they are still interested and a decision would be made by the end of the week to come, but that there were a couple other departments hiring Executive Assistants as well and would I like my information forwarded on the the respective recruiters. Mid day of the end of the following week I get a generic email, not even from the recruiter I had worked with, but stamped the talent advisors, stating they were going with another candidate. The whole process took just over a month and I have yet to hear from any other recruiters from other departments.
Interview Questions: What were my expectations of a leader?

title: Financial Aid Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Newark, NJ) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: HR first, then hiring managers. Friendly and efficient. Had a great time during the interview. The company is good and provides many resources to their staff. I enjoyed the process and was ultimately hired
Interview Questions: No basic interview questions. More about the future of the job

title: Instructional Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Phoenix, AZ)
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted directly by a WGU internal recruiter through LinkedIn (I did not apply). The message was very polite and complimentary, stating that I sounded like a good fit, with an invitation to connect by phone to learn more about their opportunities. I scheduled a phone call time with the recruiter so I could learn more about their multiple opportunities. Their recruiter then kept me on the call 40 minutes and seemed to be giving me a formal interview that I was completely unprepared for.  I was promised a follow up email to which I could respond with my resume. That email never came - I followed up with the recruiter myself through an email to which she never resodded. A couple of weeks later, I got a message through Linkedin that they had decided to go with other candidates. In retrospect, I feel that the recruiter simply wanted to learn inside information about the company where I currently work. She was VERY interested and asked several questions about my workplace, I am left questioning the whole experience and the true intentions of their internal recruiter.
Interview Questions: Tell me more about your employer

title: Student Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Reno, NV) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: The first interview was with an internal recruiter for WGU and it went very well. She asked relevant questions, was friendly, and then told me detailed information about the position benefits and schedule. It was recorded. The recording was reviewed by the team and then I was asked for the next round of interviews. This was a group interview with 3 people at once. Each of them had their own agenda with their line of questions. One person could not even turn their camera on for the interview. One of the questions was if I was okay with the salary, which I do not think should be asked during a group interview with the potential for no offer (just my opinion).
Interview Questions: Describe a story of student success. This seemed to be a repetitive type of question.

title: Loud Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Introductory call then calls with the manager and then a panel interview with the team. Overall interview is around 3-4 hrs including the intro and rest of the interview process.
Interview Questions: previous experience and technical questions

title: Social Media Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: Did not have an interview even though it was scheduled a more than a week prior to the date and time chosen by me. Instead, the recruiter cancels an interview 6 minutes before it was scheduled as a candidate was already chosen despite other candidates being in different parts of the interview process.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Enrollment Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Millcreek, UT) in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interviewing process was pretty fast.  It began with a phone interview. Once, I passed the phone interview, I interviewed with two senior managers on Campus. Once, that was completed I waited for a response. One manager called the following date, and explained the results of my interview, and provided me an offer.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had to tell someone no.

title: Digital Services Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Western Governors University in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: I am still interviewing with WGU and the culture as well as some overall information about the eight campuses was  shared. The student enrollment staff and expectations of work. The importance of flexibility and working as a team was emphasized
Interview Questions: Do you have instruction experience?

title: Enrollment Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Phoenix, AZ) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by someone in a live chat. It was awkward as the connection kept going off, and I would stay stuck talking to a black screen. They also ask very specific questions.
Interview Questions: How did you deal with an angry customer?

title: Evaluation Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interviewing for my team was pretty intense! The interview process was three rounds, two of those live. On the spot feedback for possible assessments was presented after basic getting to know you chats were completed.
Interview Questions: Q: Grade and respond to this sample per the rubric requirements.

title: Program Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Phoenix, AZ) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter phone interview followed by second with hiring manager using webcam thats recorded. It appeared to go well considering you made it to the second round only to receive a generic email that they went with other candidates but reposted the same acquisition online.
Interview Questions: Using star method describe a time you had to help someone with a difficult task.

title: Program Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: While the process took several weeks, I feel that all three interviews were beneficial in the screening process to make sure it would be a good fit. The first interview was more of a screening. The second interview had three people that I interviewed with from different departments to see where I would fit best if I fit.
Interview Questions: What makes you want to work here?

title: Legal Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Atlanta, GA) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Video interview: 
1. tells me about yourself question.  
2.  went through the resume and asked experience.  
3. Then the interview introduced the position and the university.
Interview Questions: Do you have remote work experience?

title: Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen to talk about your background, two rounds of interviews to walk through your portfolio and design challenge, and final onsite interview. The onsite interview went smooth, t the hotel they prepared is good.
