title: Course Instructor Health Professions Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: I've applied online for the Course Instructor opportunity.  I was contacted a week later to set up for a 45 minute screening with Recruiter.  The Recruiter promptly called as time and date selected.  Usually, I apply for Program Mentor opportunities and have been selected for a screening but never proceeded to next steps. I saw an Instructor position that was very relevant to my background and experience so I applied.  I have been in academics  since 2006.  What exactly is WGU looking for?  Your recruiters are backwards.  I've had too many screenings to now figure this out.   I've read negative reviews, but hesitated to write my own.  My time has been wasted too many times with WGU.  It appears that they will give someone with little to none academic experience or just want a pay check and not really passionate about their jobs.  I could be wrong, but I am guessing they are the same ones complaining about being underpaid, the University constant changes (what do they expect it's ACADEMICS), their unprofessional Supervisors, etc.  You will seldom expect this from Mentors/Instructors who have been in education for 5 or more years because we knows what to expect and this is what we enjoy.
Interview Questions: Well, this particular Recruiter just mentioned salary, training dates and length, BUT did NOT tell me anything about the job itself or what it entails.  However, she did ask me did I have any questions, they all do, but will tell you that will be discussed during next steps with Hiring Manager.  It was a 9 minute long screening.  The screening for the Mentor ops lasted a full 20 minutes.  This instantly tells me her interest right here (I've been in Recruitment once before myself:))

title: Student Success Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Western Governors University in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: You speak with a recruiter over the phone. They discuss the position, but because they are a recruiter and not someone who actually works in that department they can't answer any important questions about the job or the work you'd be doing. Also, they ask all situational questions. You must answer using the STAR method. A bunch of hypothetical questions that have little to no relevance with the actual job or your skills or experience related to it.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and why you're interested at working for WGU.

title: Course Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: I made it through 2 interviews. The first was with someone in HR. The second was with a panel of 3 over Skype. Fairly routine questions.  Asked what I knew about the company. Asked about willingness to work non traditional hours.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Mentor - Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Cincinnati, OH) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was a terrible experience with the program manager.  The manager seemed busy or distracted having two computers to  manage and take notes during the interview.
Interview Questions: What would you tell a student that is looking to discontinuing the program because he got a raise.

title: Enrollment Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Salt Lake City, UT) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: I has notified by email. I was sent a link and I had to do a 45 minute interview over the phone with them. Lots of questions. I felt like the interview was too long and it could have been condensed.
Interview Questions: I was asked about my personal education, why I would be a good fit for the company, etc. I was given several e-mail reminders about the interview and the person who interviewed me was nice.

title: Student Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Moravian Falls, NC) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received an email a few montha later. The email advised me that I had been accepted for an interview. All O had to do was pick a time slot on the calendar of the recruiter.
Interview Questions: How did I motivate someone to do something they didn't wanr to do.

title: Program Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: Applied on Indeed, received an email for a phone interview several weeks later. The phone interview was very basic with standard questions.  I was then contacted to do a video interview with 2 managers the following week. I was more than prepared, and really enthusiastic to learn more. They each asked several times why I would want to leave my current job and take what appeared to be a step down (the salary is quite low, especially living in Chicago). I explained numerous times that I was looking for a change, and I clearly demonstrated that I not only researched the position thoroughly, but also that the role was in line with my long-term goals. I can't see why I was not selected unless they just truly felt like I wasn't a good "culture fit" or that I was overqualified. I hope I don't sound arrogant, but it was truly their loss. I understood the expectations of the role & was willing to devote my full attention to mastering the role to my highest potential, I have been promoted 3yrs in a row at my current job. When I aim for success, I score.
Interview Questions: How would you convince a student to stay enrolled if they want to withdraw because "life happened"?

title: Mentor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: You are easily able to submit all needed items. The site is easy to maneuver but you wait indefinitely. You never receive and email saying " no thank you" or "the process is still continuing". It is a waiting game.
Interview Questions: Previous experience

title: Program Mentor- Undergraduate Accounting Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Western Governors University (New York, NY) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: I received an invitation to interview with HR which lasted 45 minutes. We mostly discussed what motivated me to choose this position and why now (great interview experience). I received a second invitation to interview with the program manager. This was mostly behavioral questions  lasting for 1 hour. The conversation was awkward and uncomfortable. I was only asked one question regarding student motivation.
Interview Questions: How would you respond to a student who says they are progressing when you can see they actually are not?

title: Enrollment Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Western Governors University in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: I had an extremely bizarre and unprofessional experience simply trying to setup an interview with WGU.  I passed the initial phone screening with ease but had a very difficult time making an appointment for an in-person interview. In fact, I made 4 separate appointments because my recruiter  kept canceling the times I agreed to.  I was so frustrated and annoyed by the constant calls and "oops, I know we agreed to a date and time, but we're going to ask you to change it for a 5th time now" that I let them know I wasn't interested in the position anymore.  And even after sending that communication, I was contacted two more times to say that they were canceling yet again, and could I pick a new date please? Unbelievable incompetence beyond belief. I was absolutely shocked at how unorganized their corporate office is. This went beyond just one employee that didn't know what they were doing, it seems to be organization-wide. You've been warned, as I would never recommend WGU to others and I graduated from their University!!!!!!
Interview Questions: Customer service related questions about dealing with unhappy customers and how you overcame that.

title: Enrollment Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Austin, TX) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was actually not as intense as I thought it would be for a Univeristy position. I went through a pone interview first w/ a recruiter for the Univerisity, then either that same day or the next was informed that I was selected for an in-person interview w/ an Enrollment Manager
Interview Questions: How I would help a student get through a difficult time, could be during the enrollment process or other wise

title: Instructional Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: I was scheduled for a phone interview by email, during the phone interview the recruiter was very excited to have me interview in person. I was never contacted or given an explanation as to what happened.
Interview Questions: What is your experience?

title: Internal Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Salt Lake City, UT) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview started with a phone screener, followed by separate interviews with the manager and another team member. In the last round, interviews with the director, VP and manager were held. After that, I had to hold a  one-hour presentation of my portfolio.

title: Program Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Sebastian, FL) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: An email was used to schedule a phone interview. The phone interview was basic and brief. It included an initial notice of the job salary then a  few common interview questions & opportunity ask about the position.
Interview Questions: Can you tell me about a situation where you identified an employee educational deficit /need and how you resolved it?

title: Financial Services Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Taylorsville, UT) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Wow! I have NEVER put myself through such an awful interview experience before.  

1 phone interview, 1 interview.  1 email rejection. 

Another email saying that rejection was sent in error. 

Another phone interview, almost identical to the 1st.  Another rejection email received.  

Another email saying the rejection email was sent in error, and they would like me to come in and interview again in person. 

Another in person interview. Scheduled with someone named Kelsie. Kelsie wasn't there. Ended up with the same lady as my 1st interview. Very disconnected during interview and hung up on my reasons for leaving past employers. Did not seem interested in hiring me from the moment she recognized me.  Gave me information about the position that was completely different from what others had said.  2nd interviewer in the room seemed more invested but was not leading the interview. 

ANOTHER rejection email received.  After being tossed around back and forth, watching the HR department fail miserably at communicating, and seeing how the supervisors act when they have formed an opinion,  I cannot imagine that WGU is actually anywhere near as good of a place to work as they seem to think they are. 

Get it together WGU. I am embarrassed I applied to work here, and even more so that wasted multiple days going through your process and repeating parts of the process that you couldn't seem to keep track of. Very simple stuff.
Interview Questions: why did you leave (insert every single job on my resume)?

title: Digital Marketing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter reached out to me on LinkedIn and referred me to apply via an online job posting (had been up for months) after saying they had received a lot of interest in the position. Afterward came a screening interview, a competency test, and a second phone interview with the hiring manager. After that should have come an in-person interview with the manager and the team and then an offer. However, I didn't hear anything after the second interview. I tried to follow up twice with the recruiter and once with the hiring manager and was ignored by both.
Interview Questions: They required a competency test with 5 conceptual exercises on paid online advertising (social media included).

title: Instructional Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter kept pushing  interview dates back;  timelines were continually adjusted. Had an interview and never heard back from them either way - unprofessional! I assume I won't get an offer, as the deadline to wrap things up has passed.  PLEASE let people know when you cut them loose, it's not fair to keep them hanging!!
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this job? What do you bring to the position? Tell us about a challenge you've had working on a project...typical questions.

title: Course Instructor Interview

In all there are 4 interviews: a phone interview with a recruiter, a video interview with the same recruiter, a panel interview with the Program Manager, and one with the Course Director.

Ask did recruiter tell you salary

You should not have outside employment will that be a problem for you? We only pay 50k a year is that a problem?  After being told I couldn’t have another job and would only make 50k a year we did not continue the conversation.

Interview Descriptions: First have a phone interview with HR person, then followed up with another interview with a manager. After 10 days, they asked for onsite interview . After 2 weeks I got an offer from them, but because I had another offer I reject their offer.

title: PM Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews via Adobe Meeting Room.   I felt comfortable with the interview process.  I felt like the job requirments were explained in great detail.  I did not feel like the questions were too hard.
Interview Questions: Questions regarding experience working with adult learners/ & background in education.

title: Program Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University (East Birmingham, AL) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Ludicrous maybe? First of all, they reached out to me because I had been referred to them. After clearing up that the person was asking me about the incorrect position initially, we proceeded to go through a  phone interview of sorts. There were a couple of EEOC "oops" moments on the interviewer's part, but I let those slide. After telling me that I would have to have a landline installed to work for them, we set up a time for my "webcam" interview. I was sent some information to review and directions for the call. I reviewed the materials, prepared my notes, and the day before the interview set up my home office so that the lighting and webcam angle were acceptable. I even had a landline installed (it was probably needed anyway with my husband's crappy cell service in our house).  Day of the interview, I call in as told to be informed that the recruiters no longer did webcam interviews, and we would be on the phone only, again. The interviewer apparently had lost all notes from our first interview and I got to answer the same questions over again. The paraphrasing back in short snippets led me to believe that the interviewer was typing responses in some limited format. (Well, if I had known this was a Twitter interview I would have kept my responses to 149 characters or less) I was then instructed that I would receive the same emails again that I got last time so I could prepare for the next interview with the hiring decision makers. I sent a follow up thank you email after our brief conversation, just as I had done last go around. Except this time no response. I also never got those two emails I was expecting.  No, instead I get a rejection email three weeks later turning me down for the wrong position. The position this recruiter had erroneously tried to interview me for in the first place.
Interview Questions: Why do you like working with students?

title: Business Strategy Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Salt Lake City, UT) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions:
I originally applied in July and did a phone interview and then received a thanks but no thanks email. After 4 weeks they contacted me to schedule an interview. During the first in person interview the VP discussed how Trump was elected and what the midterm elections would look like. He cursed throughout the entire hour.
Two weeks later I was brought in for a 5 hour interview with no breaks and the day of the interview the recruiter contacted me to move them time only to discover I had to wait for interviews while they were late leaving me to casually chat with the previous person for 30+ mins past the completion of the interview.
Interview Questions: Nothing unique or special but i know quite a bit about the interviewers personal life.

title: Editor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: I was invited to schedule a phone interview via email. I scheduled the interview and the day-of, I got a cancelation notice. No reason why I wasn't even granted a phone interview. I saw the position posted again the day after.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Mentor - Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Salt Lake City, UT)
Interview Descriptions: Once I applied, it took 2 weeks to get an email from them saying they wanted to interview me. I scheduled my interview online through their system. There were a lot of dates/times available. My first interview was primarily informational.  Questions like: What is your background, what do you know about WGU, do you have this internet speed, etc. There were no questions related to my qualifications for the job in this interview.  It was a brief 30 minute phone call with a recruiter. I asked the recruiter for information on their benefits, and he said he would email them. Even after sending a 'thank you' email, I never received anything from him. After 2 weeks, I received another email saying they want to do a video interview. I scheduled it again through their online system and downloaded the software. The day of the interview I waited by my laptop in the software for my interview, only to have the same recruiter call me on my phone and give me the EXACT same interview I had 2 weeks prior. Same questions, etc. It was awkward and I mentioned to him that  I already had spoken to him. 2 weeks later, I got an automatic rejection email. I couldn't believe it. So unprofessional and incredibly disappointing. The HR office really needs to evaluate their current hiring process to ensure they are not duplicating interviews and making mistakes like this.
Interview Questions:
What do you know about WGU?
Why WGU?
Tell me about your resume?
Salary expectations?
Do you have an in-home office?

title: Evaluator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Salt Lake City, UT) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my application and profile online.  One week later I was scheduled for a  telephone screening/interview.  The following week I was scheduled for a  webcam interview, and finally approximately one week later I was scheduled for another telephone interview. Overall the process was quick and informative - Very professional.

title: Course Instructor - Education Interview

title: Student Mentor Interview

title: Evaluator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Salt Lake City, UT) in Apr 2018

I was also told if I did not hear anything back in 2 weeks callback for a status update. When I call back no answer. Then followed-up with an email no response. title: Enrollment Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Phoenix, AZ) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: I had an interview with WGU and I didn't get a job offer and I have over 5 years experience as an Enrollment Advisor...they only pay 17.00 or 35,000 yr...what a joke...very low pay and other current employees will tell you the same that you prob won't get much of a pay raise even if you enroll a lot of students...must be Mormons that own this place...they have 90,000 students and over 105,000 alumni so they are making a lot of money....DONT WASTE YOUR TIME EVEN DOING AN INTERVIEW......LOOK ELSEWHERE ! and they call themselves non-profit....LOL

title: Course Instructor Interview

Mind you, when I was hired, there were people who came in the door with other jobs and people on my team that had other FULL TIME jobs. I interviewed with the person who would be my manager. He was unprofessional, flippant, and gave me the side eye. I should've known from the interview that it would not be a good experience.

title: Evaluator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Salt Lake City, UT) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: The first step was a call with the recruiter.  She was so nice and helped me feel comfortable over the phone. The interview to hire process can sometimes take several months, but luckily she noted that this position needs to be filled as soon as possible.

title: Course Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Salt Lake City, UT) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions:
If you have a terminal degree and any respect for yourself at all do not waste your time with this company.  The first recruiter that contacted me rescheduled the interview 5 minutes past the start time. The second rescheduled the interview 5 minutes before. The third told me that you have to only work at WGU the first year to be considered. First of all, this is not on their job posting. Second - this totally negates the "competency model" and "call for industry experts". I have a terminal degree and a very high ranking industry job and I am supposed to quit that and benefit the students?  It sounds like another diploma mill. Their recruiters show no respect for the people who apply so I cannot imagine how they treat their students.
If I was reviewing WGU as an outside entity (i.e. for student funding, accreditation, etc.) I would question their model based on their hiring practices.
Interview Questions: What do you know about WGU

title: Course Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Salt Lake City, UT) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: If you are chosen to interview for the position, first you will have an HR interview so that you know their basic expectations.  I'd done my research, so this didn't tell me a lot that I didn't already know.  Then I held an interview (video conference) with those who would be a colleague and a supervisor.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your experience teaching world religions? (this was for a Humanities position)

title: Program Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Salt Lake City, UT) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Went through three interviews, first was with HR, then a week later with Hiring Manager (two on the phone together), then a week later, Senior Hiring Manager; all interviews were done professionally and not too structured.  Each lasted about 30-45 minutes on the phone.  A week later, received an offer letter and completed some background check information; background check was completed with 3 business days.  Again, my interviews were via telephone.
Interview Questions: Most questions were about how to handle specific student scenarios; difficult students, or those that did not or slow turning in assignments.  What skills do I bring to the team to help these students.  Why should I hire you?

title: Human Resources Course Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Salt Lake City, UT) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: No feedback after 2nd round which was videotaped (how insulting that the managers didn't even want to take the time for a live meeting).  All I find which leads to a very cold and calloused process and most likely, organization.  Very insulting for master's degree and doctoral professionals not to hear back once you advance after the telephone screen.
Interview Questions: Why you chose WGU?  When was the last time you've gone above and beyond?  How have you helped students in the past who struggle?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: Typical, easy, quick, fast paced. Hiring team was knowledgeable, personable, friendly. They were very open to me interviewing them as well. Didn't take long. Maybe 90 minutes. Best interview process. Well worth the preparation time!
Interview Questions: Education

title: Student Mentor Interview
Application Type: The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with an HR lady, was suppose to hear back within a week. It’s not been a month and half and still nothing. Called twice and they said they are still evaluating the position
Interview Questions: What do you know about wgu

title: Course Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Salt Lake City, UT) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: Fairly generic/standard interview process...your resume is reviewed by a recruiter and if they are interested, that is followed up with a recorded webcam call with a recruiter.  If successful there, you interview with senior course mentors or departmental managers.  There seems to be a significant amount of flux among the various recruiters and higher level hiring managers...they don't seem to communicate among themselves very well because I had multiple interviews that were essential a re-hash of the previous one, just with different people. The interview seemed to know when I had last interviewed, but not with who, any notes/take-aways, or information relayed either way...felt very disjointed and poorly coordinated.  The one thing every interviewer did state was online course mentors are expected to work 45 hours a week (vice a standard 40) and one of those days needs to be a weekend and 5 hours of extra availability needed to be outside the standard 9-to-5 work hours.  Overall, the entire process seemed to go through starts and stops (i.e. hurry up and waits).  Salary seems to be the one thing no one wants to talk about until the very end of the second, third, or maybe even fourth interview.  No range is given, just a "how anyone talked to you about salary" and "what are your expectations."  Even when I referenced the average salary #s listed here in Glassdoor, I was promptly told "those numbers are too high" but no further explanation nor was an appropriate salary range given.  When you do get an offer, it seems to be a 'low ball' offer and vacation time seemed to be the only thing they would be flexible about...decided to take a pass and not pursue any further.
Interview Questions: What can you tell us about WGU?

title: Program Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Phoenix, AZ) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. A few weeks later, I received an email from HR to schedule a recorded Adobe Connect Call interview with her. It will be recorded and shared with the hiring manager. Finally, I was interviewed by two Program Managers via Adobe Connect. They told me a start date while on the phone, and that HR would contact me the next week. I followed up when I didn’t hear from HR, left a message, and then received a generic rejection email.
Interview Questions: How will you motivate adult students to complete their courses?

title: Student Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Baltimore, MD) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone call, basic info. Advance immediately to second interview which is a video chat. I must be overqualified because I have applied several times and interviewed in the second round twice without an offer. I have a feeling if they reject you after one interview- they do not consider you at all.
Interview Questions: Teaching style

title: IT Security Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: There were a panel of four interviewers. Three of them never smiled at all during the interview. This didn't feel inviting at all. If I was offered a position with them I think I would have been miserable.
Interview Questions: Explain a time when you had a problem with a client. How did you handle it?

title: Curriculum Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Salt Lake City, UT) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: I had a one-on-one video interview with the director. He was not particularly friendly and did not seem enthusiastic about conducting interviews. HR told me that the interview would be STAR method. I prepared for that, but the interviewer just asked regular on-the-job questions. He had me offer my ideas about how to improve individualized instruction. He seemed to like my ideas, and we had a productive conversation. Despite that, he did not hire me. Sometimes I wonder if he may have implemented those ideas with someone else.
Interview Questions: How would you create curriculum that was more individualized for students?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Western Governors University in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: There were three rounds of phone interviews - the final was with a group of 4 top leaders for the department. The main component was around remote coaching, strong communication skills  and ensuring I was able to provide consistent and clear guidance.
Interview Questions: Describe your experience coaching adult learners.

title: Program Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Western Governors University in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: I had a short phone interview. Afterwards, I was asked to set up a virtual recorded interview.  The interview was relatively short (25 minutes) and asked typical questions.
Interview Questions: What do you know about WGU?  Why would you be a good fit? Walk me through your resume.  What is your strength/weakness? Tell me a time when you had to deal with a difficult person (situation/task, action, result).

title: Program Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Charlotte, NC) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: very straight forward and easy . HR interview . Basically describing whats on your resume . And some additional questions about nature of job .  Also lots of information about job description, required equipment ,some travels , salary and benefits .
Interview Questions: basically describing whats on your resume . And some additional questions about nature of job .

title: Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Salt Lake City, UT)
Interview Descriptions:
Interview process consisted of a phone screen, phone interview, three in-person interviews.

Interviews consisted of average questions such as explain your current role, background, why I was looking for a change. Majority of interviewers explained their vision around role and organization.

- Phone screen was standard; overall communication was very personable, optimistic.
- Phone and in-person interviews consisted of standard interview questions as well as extensive, more relaxed conversation about our different backgrounds, strategy, etc.
- One in-person interview was focused around using technology and tools.
- Another in-person interview started 15 minutes late, interviewer seemed very disinterested and looked at their phone several times, literally barely said a word when I asked several questions, didn't walk me out of the office.
Interview Questions: Do you have a sense of humor?

title: Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Colorado Springs, CO) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Long and time consuming. I made it to the fourth interview and was basically told I would get a written offer within a week. Even given access to online portal, so I could complete an availability schedule. Never heard anything. I called...they didn't know who I was, called back a second time and they were having HR issues and someone would contact me soon, called back a third time and the 4 people I interviewed with, did not apparently work there anymore. Offered to initiate the entire process again, told I would be contacted. Fourth call got me a voice mail. Left message. One more week.  Fifth call left voice mail. Another week no response. I was just plain annoyed at this point. I hold a terminal degree and have never been treated so badly.  I called and left a voice mail, an hour later I called and left a voice mail, an hour later I called and left a voice mail, an hour later I called and left a voice mail; a half hour later I received a bulk email response that the position was no longer being hired for.  The next week, the position was back up posted on higher ED job site.  Since WGU treated me this way, I can understand all the frustration I have read from students. They wasted my time and totally disrespected me.  I will never forget.  They are foul!
Interview Questions: Online tests, online grading of papers, situational narratives

title: Accessibility Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Remote, OR)
Interview Descriptions: An offer was extended to me with a salary of 15% less than what the recruiter originally quoted me.  The offer was then taken away when I asked for the salary that was quoted to me.  They never contacted me to let me know the offer was rescinded. I finally got back in touch with them only to hear they had filled the position. It was handled in an extremely unethical way. So poor. Awful place.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at WGU.

title: Student Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and received an email with an offer to schedule an initial interview via adobe connect. Interviewed with a talent acquisition professional who outline the job and verified my resume experience. Interviewed a few weeks later with a program manager.
Interview Questions: What about your professional experience will make you a good fit as a student mentor

title: Student Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Louisville, KY) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: First received an email to set up the fisr interview. Then a few days layer was asked to interview with program manager. Two weeks later intervied with a senior manager and was told I would receive an offer the following week.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for WGU?

title: Course Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Portland, OR) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: I took part in an online Adobe Connect screening interview in which I was asked basic questions about my resume and experience and the recruiter described the position.  I was called back for a second interview, but I decided to decline as the work schedule would not work for me. The open position was Tuesday through Saturday and I was required to work from a home office and I travel some so this would not fit with my current lifestyle.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your experience.

title: Student Mentor - Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and received an invite for interview with talent recruiter within a few days.  Recruiter was very helpful to address questions about the position and what next steps could be expected in the interviewing and hiring process.
Interview Questions: What roles/positions have you held that included performance of teaching/mentoring responsibilities?

title: Student Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Salt Lake City, UT) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Lasts about 30 minutes. Interviewer was kind. Asked questions about why I am considering leaving current employer- questions about the university and competency based learning. Explained what the job entailed.
Interview Questions: What do you know about the role of a student mentor ?

title: Course Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Saint Louis, MO) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: The entire process was very quick, 3 weeks.  I sent in my application and had an interview  request the next business day.  The first interview uses adobe connect for the video and a conference line for the audio.  You need to download a plugin for adobe connect, but you arenr prompted to do so until you try to enter the conference room.  The first interview is with an hr person. They ask you about your resume. In addition to teaching experience I have lots of research experience. Rather than asking about teaching I was asked about my research background to make sure my passion is in education. They also want to make sure you have a strong internet connection and a dedicated office.  I was asked of a second interview a few hours later. The second interview is with the course mentor supervisor and the next level boss.  In this interview they ask about teaching style.  They also ask you a few different ways why you want this job. Most of the students are non-traditional, so they want to make sure you will be able to work well with that demographic.  The third interview is with other course mentors.  It was a very laid back interview.  They want to make sure you will fit in with the team.
Interview Questions: Describe your office

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Salt Lake City, UT) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Was contacted through email three days after applying, and scheduled a time to meet with the recruiter. It was suggested I review their website before the interview.

The interview lasted fifteen minutes, and I was told another may be scheduled by HR if they determined my skill set was right.

I received an email one week after the interview that another candidate had been selected.
Interview Questions: How was Western Governors founded? (direct from their website)

title: Customer Service Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Murray, UT) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions:
The recruiter was very pleasant and was the one who called to conduct the initial screening and the individual who emailed me to let me know that they had passed on my candidacy.

The interview was a two-person panel interview, which consisted of a round of questions alternating back and forth between the two interviewers.
Interview Questions:
Tell us about yourself?
What about WGU interested you in applying?
Tell me why you are interested in this position? 
How do you address conflict?
There were other questions, which I don't recall. Many were basic interview questions.

title: Course Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Western Governors University in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: I received an email to set up an appointment over Adobe Connect with an HR person.  One of the first things  mentioned was salary. My realistic  expectation was about $15,000 more than what was usually offered. She asked if I was flexible on salary, and I stated I'd like to talk with someone who was in the position to negotiate salary when the time came. I wasn't offered a position. I guess the low bidder wins!
Interview Questions: Discuss a time when there was a conflict at work. How did you handle it, and what was the outcome?

title: Student Mentor - Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Western Governors University in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview with HR for screening, basically was explained the job, travel requirements, salary, etc. 2nd interview requested next morning with program manager. Interviewed via adobe connect with him and another program manager. References requested at the end of that day. Offer two days later!
Interview Questions: Walk me through your resume. Why WGU?

title: Student Mentor - Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Salt Lake City, UT) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: 2 interviews, both via Adobe Connect. Called for 1st interview. Interviewed with Talent Recruiter. She asked basic questions about the position, school and why I was qualified. Then called on the same day for second interview. 2nd interview was with 2 Program Managers. More detailed interview with each asking questions about how I would fit into position.
Interview Questions:
Why should we hire you?
What are your strengths/weaknesses
How would you handle motivating a student with 3 kids and a 1 hour commute

title: Student Mentor - Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Putnam Valley, NY) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview was online through Adobe Connect. If this is not installed on your computer, do so before the meeting - it can take a few minutes. HR rep was very cheerful, encouraging, and easy going. Asked a few basic questions and explained requirements, promised would be in contact within 5-10 days. After interview I sent a thank you email and received a prompt, and very positive response. Two weeks later I emailed asking for information and, while I received a negative reply, was encouraged to apply for other positions.  Did so, and have an interview next week.
Interview Questions: What do you know about WGU and why are you interested in working here?

title: Student Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Salt Lake City, UT)
Interview Descriptions: Screening phone call, then a skype face to face with an hr rep, next a skype face to face with a senior manager. Everyone I spoke to was very nice and engaged. No "tricky" questions. Was asked about relevant situations. Had a good feel of the culture after the interview. Process moved quickly from submitting application, scheduling all the interviews, then the offer. Was overall one of the best interview experiences I've had
Interview Questions: Describe a time you've used critical conversation skills

title: Math Center Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Remote, OR) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied for this position and about a week later I received an email stating that I would need to set up a time for an interview via Adobe Connect with a HR recruiter, who was very polite.  He asked about my background and things on my resume.  Asked me a few questions about why this position would be a good fit for me.  I think that this interview went well.  He said that I would be contacted within a week.  I'm feeling very good about this interview.  We will see what the next seven days will bring.
Interview Questions: What caught your eye about WGU?

title: Student Mentor - Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Bristol, IL) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: I had several interviews. I applied online and was contacted via phone by a recruiter for the initial interview.  The second and third interviews were done via adobe connect with department and hiring managers.  Overall it was a pleasant process.
Interview Questions: Discuss a time when you needed to encourage a struggling student and what was the outcome

title: Course Mentor: Leadership Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Salt Lake City, UT) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: After about two weeks from application an email stating "Thank you for applying to Western Governors University. After reviewing your resume, I would like to set up a 30-40 minute interview via adobe connect for the current open position of ..." and offered a link to book time slot for the interview.  The data was confirmed by separate email with a link to connect on the scheduled day/time.
Interview Questions: Briefly describe your career path...

title: Online Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Skype interview with hiring manager as screen, then skype interview with 2 directors.  They were very nice.  Glassdoor was very helpful because I saw that other employees were not happy about having their phones monitored.  When I asked about this, they did not deny they monitor online faculty phone calls.  I could not believe that a doctorally prepared professor employee would not be trusted.  I had to decline this extremely unprofessional behavior by an employer.  Happy to say I have found another university which would never monitor phones.  Thanks Glassdoor!!!!!!!!!
Interview Questions: What experience do you have teaching online?

title: Student Mentor - Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Phoenix, AZ) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: The initial interview went great.  The interview was completed through Adobe Connect and was with a Talent Acquisition person.  She was very positive and I made me feel confident.  She even made some suggestions to help me prep for the second interview, including typical questions.  In hindsight, I think that this actually worked against me because I didn't prep as well as I normally would have and the questions she gave me were never even brought up.  The day after my interview I received a link to some online forms they needed me to fill out including my references, then the next day I received an invitation for a 2nd interview, which was a panel interview with three people.  The second interview did not go nearly as well.  The 3 on 1 approach was a little intimidating and one of the interviewers even made a snarky comment about my personality and that flustered me even more and I found myself getting off-track.  I felt as if I weren't answering their questions the way they wanted because they kept repeating them in a different way, which I know is not a good sign.  After a week I received the form email stating "We have interviewed a high number of qualified candidates and our decision was very difficult. Regretfully, after careful consideration, we are moving forward with other candidates that more closely meet our qualifications".  I have several years experience teaching online courses so I feel it was more personal than based on my qualifications, but I understand how that works in business.  I also know that the first interviewer told me that they aren't actually looking for people to "teach", instead it is more of an advisory position.  I would like to believe that perhaps my desire to teach was too strong.
Interview Questions: What is your weakness?

title: Student Mentor - Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Salt Lake City, UT) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Three interviews and an offer letter.  First interview recruiter, second interview program manager, final interview HR with an offer.  It was a little confusing. Was not sure what position I would be hired for at the end
Interview Questions: What do you know about WGU? Do you like working with students? How will you support students taking all their courses online? Have you ever taught online? Do your students like you?

title: Enrollment Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Western Governors University in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: I had an initial contact by phone. The lady was nice and she just went over the position and asked if I wanted to pursue with my application. She scheduled me for a face to face. Two managers interviewed me and they were nice too.
Interview Questions: how do you handle talking to a student about certain policy they don't agree with ?

title: Financial Services Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Salt Lake City, UT)
Interview Descriptions:
After applying and submitting my resume, I was called by the WGU recruiter for an on-the-spot phone interview where he asked about my strengths and went over the details of the job. 
After that, we set up a face to face interview with the supervisors of the department. They asked a lot about my experience in customer service and then had me write a fake email on how I would respond to a student asking about Financial Aid.
Interview Questions: Name a difficult situation with a customer that you solved.

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Remote, OR) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted immediately for an interview by an internal recruiter.    First interview was a quick phone interview where they went over the basics of the position, pay, etc.  Second interview using Adobe connect.  This interview was very pleasant and professional, definitely made me want to be part of WGU.  A week later, I was interviewed by a Senior Program Manager and another Program Manager.  The Senior Program Manager seemed bothered by having to interview me, he clearly said that he would not be my Manager (which I was relieved) .  Although it was an Adobe connect interview, he was not dressed professionally at all.  He was wearing a baseball cap and a sweatshirt. I thought this was rather odd and inappropriate for an interview.  This interview made me very uncomfortable - neither of them smiled at all during the entire process. He even seemed to become angry with my response to one of his questions, which personally, to me was an outdated question.  I almost gave up and asked to end the interview at that time,  it was that bad.  Towards the end of the interview they asked for my references and asked if I would be available to fly out there for training with a specific date.  The interview appeared as if it was going towards the positive because of all the wrap-up information that was being asked.  They even reminded me that I would not be allowed to work any other jobs for a period of one year, and that there would not be any time off allowed during that time period either.  He wanted to make sure that I would be okay with that.  Later that evening, I was emailed a rejection, certainly not what I was expecting after gathering more information for him.  However, I was relieved, I didn't feel that this was a positive experience at all and the salary that was offered did not make up for the fact that I would have had to resign from my adjunct teaching job.
Interview Questions: How would you assess  your team?

title: HRBP Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Tempe, AZ) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online and was sent a canned screening invitation a week later. I made an error on the request and emailed the sender, with no response. I was able to use the same invitation to schedule a later screen.

The phone screen lasted about 30 minutes with the recruiter. He had said the hiring manager wanted to know more about me. At the end I was told he'd submit my information to the manager who I should expect to review it in two to three days. It's been two weeks and no response. No response from the recruiter to my follow-up either.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience working with compensation plans.

title: Vice President Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Western Governors University in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions:
This was one of the most detailed and thorough academic interviews I have ever been through. Yet it was professional and well handled at almost all levels. The initial recruiter was fantastic, as was the HR manager. I had three phone interviews with them, and each interview lasted a little over an hour. The recruiter and HR person were top-notch and made the interviews go smoothly. There was a combination of behavioral and technical questions, with the focus primarily on behavioral. 

My final interview was with the President of WGU (over the phone). This interview was a little less smooth, but was still well handled. I did find it odd that there were so many phone interviews, which was out of the norm for higher education.

Also, these interviews were much more "corporate" than I imagined they would be (not a bad thing at all). At each round they asked me for concrete examples of how I managed various aspects at my prior institutions. They wanted more than "talk" and I appreciated that. More universities should ask their prospective employees for hard facts about what they have accomplished. 

Ultimately I did not get an offer, but the interview and the whole experience with WGU left a very positive impact on me. If their other employees are as solid as their HR team, it has to be a great place to work.
Interview Questions: Lots of questions about "how" I accomplished very specific things in student services, enrollment management, academic affairs. Not just "what did you do" but "how did you do it?"  Also, many many behavioral questions geared at how I would deal with others and in a matrixed reporting structure.

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Salt Lake City, UT)
Interview Descriptions:
I had a phone interview which was pretty basic. The woman interviewing me asked a couple questions that asked me to give multiple answers but would cut me off after I gave one example. She also had me watch a commencement video and study up on competency based learned but never asked about either. 

She set up an in person interview for the next week, sent a confirmation email, and then called the day before the interview to make sure I had the right time. I got a call about an hour before the interview from a man telling me I was late I asking if I got lost. I told him I thought the interview wasn't  for another hour and he told me I made a mistake and unless I could get to his office in the next 5 minutes they were going to remove my application from the pool. I called the woman who had conducted my phone interview who confirmed my interview wasn't for another hour but when I told her what happened she said "Well, then you must have made a mistake.". I had two conversations with her where she said the interview was at 11AM and an email but that didn't matter. I got a call a few minutes after my interview time from the man who called me earlier saying they made a mistake and I was right - so why was I late? I hung up the phone. 

If this University has so many problems with the interview process I'm not interesting in working there.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Enrollment Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Salt Lake City, UT)
Interview Descriptions: the interview process was once over the phone and once in person. it was quite easy and upbeat. they asked about hobbies and school experience. the interviewer was really nice, unlike the rest of the managers who were really clicking. you definitely knew who was management because they all stuck together and isolated from the rest of us.
Interview Questions: what characteristics do you have that will help you in this job.

title: Placement Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Salt Lake City, UT) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: very quick turnaround from when I talked to them to when my appt was scheduled. I met at the main office in SLC, UT and had an in person and on phone interview with all managers
Interview Questions: How I would handle multiple students and tight deadlines

title: Learning Resource Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Received an email from the recruiter three days later and interviewed with them a week after that. Another week later, I received an email from the hiring team in the department to be interviewed by them the following week. The interview was online via webcam and phone call. There were four managers on camera asking questions. I received a rejection notice from the corporate recruiter two weeks after the second interview.
Interview Questions: What is a qualification you are missing that would make you a better candidate for this position?

title: Enrollment Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Austin, TX)
Interview Descriptions: I had a 20- 30 minute phone interview and was hired the next day , they had to hire quickly and this should have been a red flag..All you need to know how to do for this job is how to use a crm , dial a phone and talk..
Interview Questions: have you used a phone before

title: Program Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Salt Lake City, UT) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and was called for a phone interview. 1 week later I interviewed over SKYPE and was offered the job 1 week after. Process took 3 weeks total.

title: Multiple Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Salt Lake City, UT) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I interviewed for two different jobs about 3 1/2 years apart. The first was for a mid level position - something like a course mentor, but I honestly don't remember the exact title. The interview was short and on site. I had 3 people asking me very basic questions and they described themselves as the "old sages" of Western Governors. They collectively had about 5-6 years experience working there, so that seemed like a bad sign. The questions were not difficult or especially specific, very general fare like "describe a work conflict and how you resolved it." At the end of the interview it was indicated that they were very interested in moving forward with my application and I would hear something "within a week." At least 2 months passed before I got a general "thanks for playing" email.

After this less than stellar experience I was hesitant to apply again even though I saw what would basically be my dream job offered (I'm not including the title since it's very specific). I did not apply but was later contacted by a recruiter. He convinced me to send my CV to him and to schedule a time to talk about the position. This phone call was supposed to be 10-15 minutes but ended up being 30 and was very much an interview. We had a nice chat, even though he was trying WAAAAAYYY too hard to convince me of the legitimacy of WGU. He told me he was passing my application on and that I would be contacted within 10 days and that if I hadn't heard anything by then I was supposed to let him know. 10 days passed with no follow up so I sent a brief "hey remember me?" email. No reply. It's been nearly a month since our first communication and almost 3 weeks since I was told I would hear something in no more than 10 days. I still might hear back but communication has been either instant to the point of being pushy or non existent.

Both experiences have indicated a great level of enthusiasm on their part followed by cut off communication. I hope this doesn't sound like sour grapes because I wasn't offered the jobs. I'm quite employable and was unsure of working there to begin with. I fully understand employers get busy and focus their time and energy on the person they intend to hire, but it's inexcusable to reach out to someone, get their hopes up, and then cut off contact.
Interview Questions: What is your understanding of this position?

title: Student Mentor Interview
