title: Learning Resource Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Charlottesville, VA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: There are three rounds of interviews. First interview is with recruiting to check your overall experience and compatibility with the job requirements. The second interview is with the manager of the specific team. The third interview is with additional members of the team along with the manager.
Interview Questions: When is a time that you have failed and what did you learn from it?

title: Student Mentor - Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Western Governors University in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews and an offer. First with recruiter, second with Sr Program manager. Done via phone and webcam. Felt informal yet professional. Gave good information and candid answers to my questions.  Still haven't met direct supervisor but was given a name during the offer conversation.
Interview Questions: Walk me through your resume.

title: Evaluator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: I spoke on the phone for 30 minutes.  The interview seemed to go really well.  I was called back a couple of days later.  The interviewer asked if I would be willing to move to Utah.  The position was listed as remote.  I am unable to move so I didn't get it.
Interview Questions: I was asked about the mission of WGU.

title: Student Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: 3 interview process. First interview is from human resources checking to see how well you fit for the job opening. Second interview is from a department head. Third interview is the actual job offer.
Interview Questions: What is a problem you recently solved and explain how you dealt with it successfully.

title: Clinical Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview initially...was told if I didn't hear from anyone in a week to call back. I called back and was told by my interviewer that the notes taken during my phone interview were misplaced and if I could resend my resume. After doing that, never heard back. I took that as a "we don't want you"
Interview Questions: How would you use the competencies in the program in your everyday life?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Phoneton, OH) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Casual honest conversation involving talking through resume, and why i was interested in the position. They shared info about the specific job responsibilities, benefits and other helpful information. Talked for about a half hour
Said they would contact me in the next week if the next level of interviewer wanted to talk with me
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Student Mentor - Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Completed initial interview, then was scheduled Adobe Connect/phone interview with member from HR. Next step was for my recorded interview to be sent on to Nursing Management for review, and would then possibly hear from them for an interview, which I have not yet.
Interview Questions: What are you thought and views on technology and how is it a part of your life?

title: Student Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: I went through 3 or 4 interviews  before being hired.   The first one was with a recruiter that wanted to let me know what to expect from the job .  The questions were basic interview questions.  I talked to a 2nd recruiter that asked a lot of the same questions.  They wanted to put me on hold for a few months since it was January and I couldn't start until the current school year was over so he said I would be contacted in March for a 3rd interview.   I didn't hear anything until sometime in April when I was contacted about another recruiter asking me the same questions again.  I explained that I have heard all of this same thing before and after he did some checking, realized my application had been put in the wrong pile.  I was finally able to talk to someone in May from the Teacher's College that asked more specific questions.  I was finally offered the job the night before my last day of the school year.  It was a long process but that was my fault because of when I could start.
Interview Questions: Do your research about Western Governor's University.  They ask a lot of questions about what you know about them and about the specific position you are applying for and about their competency model.

title: Student Mentor - Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Salt Lake City, UT) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online, got an email about 3 days later for initial phone interview. After first interview, got an email immediately following requesting a second interview via a skype type program.

During the first interview, they told me the second round interviews would be "behavior" based. Basically what would you do in different situations. We got through my past work history and then he started asking me about my current work. He basically ended the interview after hearing that I am currently working (even though I told him I was looking to remove myself from my current position). He said that he had "everything he needed and we were done." Very odd considering he asked my NOTHING to get to the conclusion I wouldn't be right for the position.
Interview Questions: Are you currently working?

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Salt Lake City, UT) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: On day 1, I met with the Manager of Software Engineering for about an hour. I explained my background and experience. I answered a number of technical questions related to the position which involves RESTful Web Service development and general object oriented programming concepts. Day 2 (the next day), I met in the room with 3 people. This included the same manager, the Director of Mobile Development, and a Sr. Engineer. I was asked to explain my background and experience. The Director asked me some object oriented programming questions. I was then tasked with writing pseudo code on the white board for a basic REST service.
Interview Questions: Explain composition...

title: Student Mentor - Faculty (St Louis, MO) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Saint Louis, MO) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online for various positions and continuously send typical generic email telling me that they have decided to go with someone with more qualifications.  I have 13+ years of experience in the field and they continue to decline me BUT keep reposting the same jobs.  Very irritating as I would love to work for them.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for WGU?

title: Senior Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Remote, OR) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had two interviews with different recruiters. On both instances, the interviews went well and I was told I was being submitted to the next step. I was asked if I was okay taking a large pay cut, given the salaries are a fraction of the corporate counterparts. I was fine given I was ready to move into teaching. Then, I was asked if I could commit for 12 months to ensure WGU was my only employer. I said "yes" again.
Interview Questions: I was asked the typical questions and, in my case, why did I want to take a pay cut and leave corporate America to teach.

title: Enrollment Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Salt Lake City, UT) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Met with Sr Director for 30 min. Waited 5 weeks for response and offer. Received an offer, was told there was no salary negotiation. Accepted the offer and was given a start date 3 weeks out.
Interview Questions: How I handled keeping students engaged and moving through the enrollment steps.

title: Evaluator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Remote, OR) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Phone interview- questions regarding the university and online learning
writing assessment--- responding to papers submitted by students (hypothetical) 
A review of computer needs
knowledge of basic computer programs - Blackboard- Taskstream- Office 360
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to work for WGU
Why an online environment
What do you know about WGU
What do you know about competency based learning
What is your opinion about competency based learning

title: Student Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Salt Lake City, UT) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: The application was submitted on line. The process has been very long but once I received the phone interview the process move along. I received an email to set up a time for the phone interview. The option to allow me to set a time with the recruiter's calendar was convient and professional. Also, I was given an option to reschedule.
Interview Questions: A lot of questions about why you want this position?

title: Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Salt Lake City, UT)
Interview Descriptions: Submitted online. Received a call from HR to discuss the position and my experience. Met with screening manager to discuss my goals and the fit with the company. Interviewed with individuals in the department to determine fit. Final interview was with the Program Manager to discuss position. Job was offered and told HR would follow up. Follow up came with salary and formal position offer.
Interview Questions: Focused on experience and career path.

title: Course Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Rome, GA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview lasted about thirty minutes.  The person conducting the interview was friendly and easy to talk to.  They asked basic background questions and asked for specific examples of providing assistance to students that resulted in both positive and negative outcomes.  They asked about my ability to meet specific work requirements on weekends and after hours.  The interview experience was very positive.
Interview Questions: What attracted you to Western Governors University and what do you know about us?

title: Evaluator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: Started with a phone screening, then a web cam interview, followed by a longer phone interview.  They picked up my resume several months after I applied for a different job within the university.
Interview Questions: They were interested in my background as a teacher, my opinions on grading and feedback, and my level of comfort with doing work online.  We discussed the WGU competency-based model as well.

title: Student Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Saint Louis, MO) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview first, followed by webcam interview within a couple weeks. Technical issues with the first, but not the second. Both went reasonably well. Got a friendly rejection email within a normal time frame but not as soon as they'd indicated. I'm guessing they are looking for salespeople and people who aren't actually interested in student success. If you're competitive and driven by numbers but can pretend to also like students then this might be for you.
Interview Questions: What makes this a good next step in your career?

title: Student Mentor - Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is virtual.  You have to submit video.  In addition there is about 3 interviews. It is encouraged that you be informative, have real-life experiences, and smile.
Interview Questions: Why would you make a great student mentor?

title: Student Mentor - Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my resume & an application for five student mentor positions posted on the WGU web site. Within a few days I received an email acknowledgment. About a week later I received an email request to set up a telephone interview. It was very simple to schedule the time online and I received a call from the recruiter. He was pleasant and friendly, asking standard questions about my background, my salary expectations and my schedule flexibility. He also explained the process for training and discussed potential start dates for training in Salt Lake City. The interview went well and I am hopeful I will proceed to round two of the process and be offered a position.
Interview Questions: What was a situation that caused you to reevaluate or reflect on your actions?

title: Alumni Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Seattle, WA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Just had the initial interview.  I was sent a link to pick an interview time which was very convenient.  Call occurred on time.  I was asked a few questions and told there would be an evaluation and if there was a good fit a follow up interview.
Interview Questions: Why did I apply to WGU

title: Assessment Developer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: Very slow process.  Started with HR in May and was followed with three more interviews which ended in  mid June.  In mid-August I still have not heard.  After an interview I expect a response and find it very disrespectful when companies do not have the decency to inform people they interviewed that the position has been filled.
Interview Questions: A lot of questions about what you want in a position.

title: Cousre Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions:
First received an email for phone interview with HR. That interview went well, just asked basic questions. A few days later received a second email to interview with "team." Prior to the interview I was required to write an essay and upload a video presentation. I was never told what the presentation was to include, just to submit one. THIS WAS A LOT OF WORK.. I submitted the required materials the day before the second interview. This interview was a interview with three interviewers. We could all see each other on the screen. They asked fair questions, nothing out of the ordinary and seemed very nice. I was not, however, offered the job. I found that out in a subsequent email. 

My problem with this institution is that one has to pretty much "work" - without pay- for the interview and THEY NEVER ONCE referred to or critiqued the work submitted. IN fact, I wasn't even sure they received it. When I asked, they said 'yes' and moved on to basic type questions. Perhaps they should require the WORK be submitted after the second interview after they meet you and decide you are a good fit. Left a bad taste in my mouth.
Interview Questions: What do you think would be the biggest challenge in this job?

title: Academic Integrity Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Salt Lake City, UT) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: First round was with an outside recruiter. Second round was with the entire team. They asked behavioral questions and wanted someone who could work on weekends as well as during the week. The interviewer mentioned that the school would provide a computer and pay the internet bill. For the most part, the second interview was decent. It was obvious that one team member wasn't interested even if the others were. That was a bit unprofessional, but overall the experience was okay. It takes quite a while to progress from application submission to the panel interview.
Interview Questions: What is something you're constantly working on in your professional life?

title: Associate Enrollment Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Salt Lake City, UT) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Got a call from my interviewer letting me know what day and time they set up my interview. When I arrived for my interview, I had to sign in and wait only a few minutes to be seen. She was professional but kind. She got straight to the interview and asked me about myself, my current job, my availability, etc.
Interview Questions: The asked me to talk about myself which I understand is cue for "tell me if you'd be hirable".

title: Course Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Tucson, AZ) in Jul 2015

They also asked for a presentation and some written documentation answering some questions.  There was a bit of time between the interviews.

title: Course Mentor Interview

I set up the appointment, but no one called me, so I set up an appointment for the following day.  A representative called me that day, but sounded like she had not read my resume or cover letter.  I was told my information would be sent on to a manager and if he/she is interested, he/she would call me.
Interview Questions:
What do  you know about our company?  Are you working now?  What questions do you have for me?

title: Student Mentor - Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Valrico, FL) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Took 5 weeks for first interview was a call interview.  The second interview went well was with the head of IT mentoring.  The interview was done via Adobe Connect room and we were on camera.  We covered what my duties would be.  Discussed what made me the "perfect" candidate. Received a call back from the first interview lady who was wondering if my interview went well.  I felt pretty confident.  I had heard for a while so I reconnected with the first interview lady, who gave me a number to reach HR.  I had contacted HR.  Shortly after that call, I was called again by the head of IT Mentoring and offered me a position.  I took it and was on my way to Salt Lake City, Utah for a week training.  Company paid for airfare, lodging and food for the whole week.  It was a great learning experience.
Interview Questions: What made me the "perfect" candidate?

title: Course Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Houston, TX) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was amazed with the interview process.  They were very efficient....They contacted me the next day after I submitted my application.  I waited for about a week to hear the results, which was a promised they made.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose to apply at Western Governors University?

title: Course Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: 7-8 week interview process. First is clearly screening, 2nd is with a manager (equivalent of a department head), 3rd with the equivalent of faculty. Throw in an original teaching video and essay. I was impressed with the process until the final round, when the job description clearly changed from the one I had discussed in previous interviews (and from the job description I applied to). I was on board with the integrity of WGU until I found out that one of the faculty members who interviewed me had an educational background that would never be acceptable in a brick-and-mortar graduate program in this subject area. What is worse is this faculty member was seemingly never apprised of interview protocol--like asking personal questions about my family and how my family feels about my potential career move.
Interview Questions: The first 2 rounds were standard and SME-related. The third round involved questions about another subject-matter area clearly outside my expertise. I was essentially asked, "Could you cover those if I cannot?"

title: Student Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied via the WGU job site. I was contacted almost a month later about a phone interview (prescreening). I spoke with a recruiter for about 30 minutes. He asked general questions about my availability, backgroud, salary, and other jobs that I may have. A few days later I was called by a manager for a Skype interview. It was a little odd being on the phone and see the person through the computer. The questions were very basic.
Interview Questions: What do you know about Western Governors University?

title: Student Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University in May 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Applied for the position in late-March and received an email from the university in early May requesting I schedule a telephone interview. 

Scheduled the phone interview for later that same week. That interview lasted just over 30 minutes where basic questions were asked as well as going over my qualifications as well as basic information about the position (pay, required travel, when available to start, etc). The interviewer was very pleasant and easy to talk to. At the end of our conversation, the interviewer indicated that the next step in the process was an interview conducted with a senior HR person. That next interview was scheduled for the following week. 

The second interview was a little more in depth. The webcam interview was new to me and it was a little discerning watching yourself interview on the screen, but the HR interviewer was extremely easy to talk to and very knowledgeable about the position. Questions asked were very typical of most interviews and the interviewer went over much more of the position responsibilities, compensation and benefits. This interview took about an hour.
Interview Questions: What would you say your strengths are?

title: Instructional Designer Interview

Why do you want to work here.

What do you know about WGU?
What do you know about our model?

title: Course Mentor Interview

It took a few extra days, but they e-mailed me early the next week to let me know that I was not moving forward.  No reason was given.

title: Student Mentor Undergrad Interview

Interview Descriptions: Fast and timely.  Recruiter contacted via email and set up a time to talk.  Web cam was required.  Recruiter asked questions regarding prior work experience and what prior education experience I had.  Interview was about 10 to 15 mins.  Received a response with the outcome of the interview within 2 weeks.
Interview Questions: Asked about previous work history.

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Salt Lake City, UT) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer was robotic in nature and appeared to be bothered with his involvement in the interview process. He was cold and not very personable. I asked what next steps were in the interview process to receive a response that was rushed and provided the perception that he had already decided I wasn't going to be considered further. He then took over a month to get back to me on a simple email. The response I received was, sorry for taking long to return you email, your ES will be contacting you shortly. My current ES was the person to inform me that I was not chosen for the position rather than the interviewer. It should have come from the interviewer rather than a third party. Ohh, and in the meantime of responding to my inquiry about my standing in the interview process he went on vacation! He called my current ES at 5:00 pm to ask for her to give him a call back. She called within ten minutes and she received a voice message that stated he will be out of the office on vacation for the next week. The interviewer should certainly not be left to his own devices. They need to reconsider this guy being involved in any interview process.
Interview Questions: What makes this position the next logical choice in your career?

title: Evaluator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Telephone, TX) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: You interview with a couple of different people that are at different levels.  The first interviews tells you a lot about the position which allows them and you to see if you are a potentially good fit
Interview Questions: About a time you had a conflict with another employee and how you resolved it.

title: Student Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions:

The recruiter was pleasant to talk to and we had a great conversation about my work history, what I knew about WGU, salary, the 12-month rule on no other employment, and something not mentioned in other feedback on Glass Door, if you get hired, there is a 1-week training course you have to attend in Salt Lake City, Utah.

No offer yet, being the first interview. I hope to go to the next round of interviews, the job description was a perfect with for someone with my KSA's, education, and overall background.
Interview Questions: The one question about a challenging situation or how I handled it was typical of other phone interviews I have had in the past

title: Assessment Program Manager Interview

Waiting on second interview.
Interview Questions: When have you had to change/ adjust to get a desired result.

title: Student Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Salt Lake City, UT) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: The only complaint I have is that this took so long to get hired! The interview was straight forward and easy, typical questions. First was a phone interview, then was an in person presentation.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Mentor - Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Indianapolis, IN) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: The first interview was a phone interview.  Basic questions were asked, and the interviewer kept saying "perfect". There were questions about why I thought I would be a good fit for the position, what I knew about WGU, and my schedule including my flexibility.   I did not hear back after this interview and have decided to go in another direction.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Course Mentor Web Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Western Governors University in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions:
A recruiter from Western Governors University contacted me.

The recruiter actually performed the same review twice. It appeared the person was over worked and so a lot of questions I answered twice and in each case you could tell they were trying to type what you were saying into a computer.

The next step was a hiring person who did similar questions. Nothing too technical and in many ways seemed not knowledgeable about the mentoring technical requirements. A third person was brought into that interview with some very easy technical questions that were related to the course content.

A mistake was made in the next step where I was requested to produce a video but the topic was incorrect and for another course. This showed a problem dealing with their own technology keeping track of who they were interviewed and for what position. 

Once I got that corrected I had to think if I wanted to spend time producing a video. The question was poor and showed a complete lack of knowledge for the subject matter. 

I choose to put in the time and produced a video. I also provided the answer they requested about why this is the next step for your career. To be honest this job looked more like a first step or a retiring step in a career based on pay scales and simplification of work for such employees which is ok but not a next career step type of question job. Still I answered it as it is a typical employment item you would expect. 

I submitted these to the requested email address. I got an out of office message. I never got a confirmation about receiving these which at the minimum would be a thanks, we got these and we will update you in the interview process. 

I watched my Vimeo site to see if the video I submitted was viewed. It has never been viewed. After a week I figured I was cut from the list. I checked about a month later to also see that the video was not reviewed.

Seven weeks later an automated template email came, long after I had written the job off myself. 

Overall the interview process is impersonal. It has the annoying aspect of being on the phone and people trying to take notes in a computer and then getting them wrong. 

I would recommend that they do not have the correct training for the interviewers to handle this. The better solution is to handle the interview process without any human contact and do it the same way they run the courses. Provide all the questions and let the candidates submit answers. Then once you have good solid information, have the phone interviews. Do not waste people's time with going from verbal to written transcribing.
Interview Questions:
Part of the interview process was to answer a technical question using a video and a statement why the position was the the best next step in your career.

On submission of these documents, there was no acknowledgement of receipt other than an out of office message. Was informed the person requesting them would be on vacation when they would be submitted. 

Also the video, a special request of the interview process, was placed into Vimeo showed no viewers.

It took 7 weeks for an automated message to update the interview process.

title: Student Mentor - Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Toledo, OH) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: initial phone interview and then 2 Skype interviews   The initial phone interview was a screening-  the first online face to face was with HR representative and the 2nd was with a senior member of management
Interview Questions: name a time a student was failing.  How did you help them become successful?

title: Student Mentor - Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Contacted by a recruiter within a day of submitting an online application. Second interview with program manager was within a week. The recruiter was very polite and the interview took about 20 minutes. Second interview was conducted via adobe connect, and lasted approximately 40 minutes. Overall everyone was very professional and respectful. Received an email three weeks after the last interview informing me that they selected a different candidate.

title: Admissions Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Salt Lake City, UT) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straight forward, basically trying to see if you are a good fit. Detailing how their company works and their history. The job duties and expectations are covered of course and then you get to ask questions about the company.
Interview Questions: How do you react to working with a large group of people.

title: Student Mentor Interview

title: Student Mentor Undergrad Interview

Interview Descriptions: I was contacted shortly after having completed my online application. A telephone interview was scheduled. I received an e-mail with the times and days available. I responded immediately. My interview was scheduled the following day. If I were to mention any negative, I found the interviewer a little disconnected with the conversation.
Interview Questions: The questions were not difficult.

title: Instructional Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Received an e-mail from HR inviting me to participate in a 30-minute phone interview about two weeks after I applied. HR rep was very nice. Asked typical questions and even discussed salary range. Be sure you know the history of WGU (on their website). A department head called the next day to schedule a Skype session. A week later, another department rep called to schedule a phone interview. Hiring process is ongoing at the time of this entry.
Interview Questions:
Expect typical interview questions. Be sure that you are able to articulate why you want to work specifically at WGU and be prepared to answer questions like:
"Describe a typical day in your prefect idea of what this job entails"
"What has been your greatest accomplishment working in the field of education?"
"Why are you a good fit for this specific position?"

title: Student Mentor - Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Western Governors University in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions:
I received an email from a recruiter through Linkedin requesting to speak with me about the position. I scheduled a time to speak with the recruiter the next day.  She discussed the position and duties. The interview was very basic. Asked questions about skills that apply to this position, background,.all pretty standard interview questions.  The recruiter indicated that I would be a good candidate and asked that I complete the application for the position on the WGU site.  Two days later I received a call back from the recruiter letting me know that I had been recommended for a second interview and to expect an email shortly.  Later that afternoon, I received an email for the second interview with the hiring manager. This was an Adobe session, so instructions were provided for logging in and checking your web cam.  This second interview was again very basic, I believe I asked more questions than the interviewer did.  This person asked questions like tell me about your experience and background and how they fit this position. 
Second interview again was a very pleasant experience. We discussed the company culture and the importance of supporting student success. We discussed a potential start date if I were chosen and I was told I would get a follow up if selected. This manager did explain that there could be a third interview, but she was not sure  -- but I would definitely get a follow-up within the week. This second interview would turn out to be my final interview.Within a week, I received an email stating that I was being offered the job and to provide a time convenient to discuss the details.

This was another manager. This person congratulated me for being accepted officially offered me the job. Discussed all the benefits and gave me the salary. There was no negotiation necessary as the salary offered was exactly what I wanted and expected based on my research of the company. 

All in all excellent experience. Everyone in the process were more than supportive in answering any and all questions I had.  This company really knows what they want and how to get it.  I personally have never had a better interview experience and I have been working for the past 20+ years.

The hiring process was very easy and straightforward. I was told by the hiring manager what each step would be, what to expect and when.  I received an official offer letter, background check information, travel arrangement information, etc. All within days of the offer. 

Outstanding experience !
Interview Questions: There were no difficult questions." Give examples of helping others overcome obstacles?" Explain a Positive and Negative outcome of this task.

title: Student Mentor Interview

Interview Descriptions:

For the second interview, I was not told it would be a video interview until the manager asked me to approve the camera. His demeanor was much less friendly than the recruiter from the first interview. He asked if I had any questions about salary. When I asked if there was room for discussion about working elsewhere, he became agitated and said there was no reason to move forward with the interview if I could not commit to only working there. Due to the low salary, this was not something I could agree to, so the interview ended there.

We discussed salary options and other compensation (like the possibility of working from home).  The associates I met with described their typical 'day' on the job and various likes and dislikes about the job/company.  Everything was very conversational/casual in tone with minimal stress.

title: Student Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions: The process took about a month. The first was a 30 minute phone screening and the interviewer was very positive. He outlined some of the differences between WGU and traditional colleges. During the second interview, I was shown a copy of the metrics used to measure mentor performance and a sample schedule. Both of these were explained. A possible start date was discussed. I was not informed at the time that there were other possible start dates. About a week later, I received an email with a time for a third interview. This interview date would not have allowed me to give a notice to my current employer, which I had stated in both interviews was important to me. The interviewer refused to move the time, saying instead that I might be considered for future positions. During this interview, I felt some questions were judgmental due to my current employment position.

title: Student Mentor Undergrad Interview

Then one day I get a call out the blue and it is a recruiter from HR calling for the phone interview.  I told him that I wash't expecting to do the interview that particular day since I never received a confirmation email from them.  The interview was very short, maybe ten minutes. He asked me about my work experience and to name a time where I have helped someone. He told me that I would be expecting a call regarding a possible second interview in about two weeks ago, but it has been over two weeks and I haven't heard anything back.

title: Course Mentor - Management Interview

Interview Descriptions: 1st Interview was a brief fifteen minute phone call.  This call involved just getting some basic information.  Questions were;  Why WGU?  Have you researched WGU? Tell me about your work history briefly.  Pretty standard questions.  The 2nd Interview involved writing an essay about why WGU and what you would bring to the table for the students of WGU and a video lecture about a content area you are an SME in.  The main caveat is the video "should" incorporate you in it. I feel this was standard for an online position.  They want to "see" you and your writing style.  The 3rd Interview was an Adobe web conference with a Program Manager, Faculty Lead, and Faculty member.  It was more or less a round-robin behavioral/situational question interview.  I was not moved up in the process but was told their would be a 4th and 5th interview.  I think this is overkill to fill a full-time faculty position.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Phoenix, AZ) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online with WGU  and 10 days later I received an email to schedule a phone interview. The phone interview asked standard questions with an HR Recruiter..Tell me about your experience/education? Describe a day as a student mentor?  Very friendly interviewer, very pleasant experience.  told me that I should expect a call later that day or the next, regarding a follow-up, About 10 minutes later I received an email to schedule a second interview, this time by video.  Second interview with another HR recruiter, very pleasant, asked standard questions very similar to first interview.  Discussed salary, advised again of policy about not working for other companies during the first year. Discussed availability for one week training. Advised that I would be contacted within a week either by a program manager for a 3rd interview or by HR to decline moving forward in the process.
Contacted within a few days with a standard form email stating that I was not selected for a final interview. The email used to send the message does not let you respond back. Very disappointing not knowing how to improve
Interview Questions: All questions were very standards and straightforward. No difficulty if you are experienced interviewing. If you are not experienced, just do a little research about the best way to answer standard interview questions. If you are not in education, do some research about student support/student learning, etc. or just on teacher interviews.

title: Course Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process took 10 weeks.  I had one telephone interview with HR, prepared a 45 minute recorded Power Point presentation, one telephone interview with a Program Manager, and two Adobe Connect interviews with a Couse Mentor Facilitator and Senior Program Manager. The process was going smoothly and quickly, especially when I expressed that I had another offer on the table.  At the final interview (I was told it was the last) I was warned that it might take a "few weeks" before I heard a response.  They even contacted my references.  Well, that "few weeks" turned into a month and a half, and I was lied to twice about when I would hear a decision during my follow-up conversations.  I received an e-mail stating that I was not chosen for the position, except it was not the exact title of the position I interviewed for! The e-mail also stated that I was not selected as a finalist, which contradicts my conversations with HR and management.

While I don't think many companies have favorable "rejection" practices, it seems like this would be a difficult place to work.  I would expect that professionals who obtained their doctoral degree would be treated with more respect, but I guess not!
Interview Questions: The questions were surface-level questions and didn't focus on the job itself.  It was also clear that my resume had not been read in advance.

title: Enrollment Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Salt Lake City, UT)
Interview Descriptions: The interview itself was not very difficult, but when you apply for a promotion for a job that pays about $35K a year they treat the interview process like it's a $100k job. There was a phone interview, in person interview, and then another phone interview with different person. The worst part about the hiring process is the disfunction that the recruiting department has. I had to apply for the jobs three times for them to get their act together. The first time the lady I talked to on the phone really liked me and said she was going to call me back in a couple of days when she got back from her business trip to schedule an appointment for an in person interview. a few days passed and I hadn't heard from her so I called and left her a message. She got back to me a few days later and said she thought she had called me and left a voicemail to schedule an appointment, then proceeded to tell me she filled all of the positions and would call me when they were hiring again. I never heard back from her again. The next time a position opened my friend who works there went directly to the hiring manager with a referral for me so I wouldn't fall through the cracks again. He looked at my application and told my friend he would definitely contact me for an interview. Once again the job closed and he said he forgot to call. This frustrated me so I contacted HR and was handed a bunch of excuses about the previous incidents and the head recruiter I spoke with looked at my resume and said she would interview me personally the next time the position opened and make sure I was brought in for an interview with the hiring manager. Once again, I didn't hear back so I applied a third time and was finally interviewed the three times and hired. If it wasn't for the fact that I'm a student and wanted the tuition discount, I probably wouldn't have applied a third time. There was way too much hassle. Low and behold, I applied for a promotion and they somehow lost my new resume I submitted and went off the old one. I was called and told I wasn't being considered for the position because I didn't bother to update my resume with my current position and I didn't make a cover letter for it even though it was an internal hiring and I worked directly with the person doing the hiring.
Interview Questions: Why are you indispensable? Kind of a weird question for an entry level job with high turnover.

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Salt Lake City, UT) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied on WGU's website in December and received a phone call from the project manager a month later. An email with details about the interview arrived two days after the phone call. The email was clear about where the interview was to be held and what to bring. It was a panel interview with three interviewers, who asked questions specific to the position with emphasis on working with a team and meeting tight deadlines.
Interview Questions: This question caught me off guard as I was not in the mind set to describe my past literature review. After describing some research I had done, the question went something like this: What did you think of the literature you read (social science literature related to the environment)?

title: Course Mentor Interview

Interview Descriptions:
Completed online application and received an email a couple of days later requesting a phone interview. Completed phone interview with HR rep who was pleasant enough. interview was straight forward and casual lasted about 15 mins.  Felt the interview went well and HR rep stated I would be a good fit and that I should hear back in 10 days from program manager for a second interview via Adobe Connect if they wanted to proceed.   
Never received any further communication from that initial interview. Not even a  standard 'thank you but no thanks' email. So I was very disappointed in having gone through the application process and the first interview and just left hanging. Not very professional and could be an indicator of their work culture , as if this is how they treat their applicants then I can only imagine how they treat their employees.

Session was manipulative. Was not polite. In fact, was very rude. He had already had his mind set and it was obvious he was going through the motions. 5 years as a Communications professor, one becomes quite aware of body language and tone. Waste of time. Agree with previous that there is some type of discrimination going on probably.
Interview Questions: What is it that you did at University of Phoenix? Upon answering, he rudely state, "Oh and that was at University of Phoeeeenix." So rude young man. I don't even know how he is not being watched. His linkedin shows he started as a lowly enrollment counselor. Waste of time. contacted IT manager I knew from previous year's interview (which was great) who did nothing about it. Looks like a lot of politics.

Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Indianapolis, IN) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was put through a screening interview first with a recruiter from the main headquarters. The interview style was a little cold and impersonal, just basic screening questions. Afterwards, I was brought in for an in-person interview with the Chancellor. The interviewer was a little late to the interview. We started out with some small talk and the generic "Tell me about yourself" question, which I usually keep brief. Aside from 1-2 other quick questions, the interviewer did not ask my any other questions about myself or my experience - very odd. I asked her several questions, but the whole interview was over quickly, in less than 20 minutes.
Interview Questions: The interviewer did not not ask many questions at all - I wish I would have given more project examples in the "Tell me about yourself" question.

title: Course Mentor Interview

title: Junior Java Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Salt Lake City, UT) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions:
I was first contacted by a staffing agency and after our call, WGU set up an initial interview.  During the first interview I was asked questions about Java and SQL.  The Hiring manager explained the company and what the position I was interviewing entailed.  He explained that it is not a Java developer position, but a SalesForce developer position using a Java like language APEX.  The interview went good and he arranged a second interview with the Java guru and the SalesForce manager as well as himself.

The second interview did not go as well.  I prepared well for the interview assuming that they would ask Java related questions again, but instead asked Web Services related questions which I was not prepared for.
Interview Questions: What does the action and method attribute in the HTML <form> tag do.

title: Enrollment Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Western Governors University
Interview Descriptions:
It is a two to three step process, depending on the exact position applying for.   
The first interview is a panel consisting of the office manager and up to four enrollment supervisors.  It can be online, on the phone or in person.  The second interview is often with the Director of Enrollment. If there are more interviews needed it is frequently because of close comparison between eligible candidates.
Interview Questions: It has been seven years since I interviewed for employment. I have had interview for promotion and new positions, but they were internal.  The most challenging question I was asked for a promotion to team lead: what was one negative situation that you had (with co-worker or prospective student), what did you do and how would you change it.

title: IT Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process took a few steps. I met with a group of information technology employees. I then met with the manager of that department. The last meeting was with one of the IT executives.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: Initial recruiter phone screening, then passed on to senior manager with a request for a video interview.  After 30-minute video interview, passed on to two of manager's reports, for another tag-team interview.  This interview was longer due to the two questioners, but still focused on same things.   After this interview, was thanks-but-no-thanks-ed.
Interview Questions: I asked about the metrics used for rating student mentor performance, as I had read up on this ahead of time & it came off as a sticking point for current mentors.

title: Course Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Salt Lake City, UT) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: It took a long time.  Over a month.  Had around 4 interviews.  A couple from HR, one to see if I knew my stuff, and then manager type interviews.  Overall I think it took too long, it could of been done quicker.
Interview Questions: The typical dumb interview questions they always ask.  What is your greatest strength, what is your greatest weakness, etc.

title: Instructional Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Salt Lake City, UT) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: I applied online for this position. I was contacted via email about 1 week later with a request for an initial phone interview and given several dates and times to select from. I responded with a time that I would be available. The phone interview went very well and I was contacted 2 days later with a request for an in person, on-site interview the following week. I went to this interview which consisted of 4 individual meetings, one 2 person panel interview and a lunch meeting. I THOUGHT the interviews went very well. My potential supervisor even discussed salary and benefits with me and asked if I would be able to attend a week of training and conferences two weeks later (I said I would be able to). He said he thought I was a perfect fit for the position. He talked about getting me a computer and phone (this was a remote position). He said he had to talk briefly with a few other people the next week and that he would be in contact with me the following week. I left the interview thinking I actually had the job. I did not hear from anyone the following week so I sent this guy an email - no response. I left a voice message with HR the next week - no response. I left the guy a voice message the second week after my interview (the week of the training and meetings) - no response. I left a second voice message with HR the 3rd week after my interview - no response. FINALLY after over 4 weeks, I got a 2 sentence email from HR that they had selected another candidate. I have NO idea what went wrong. I have NO idea why this guy would all but offer me the job and then have NO contact with me again. What a waste of time for me.
Interview Questions: All questions were pretty standard, work history related.

title: Systems Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Salt Lake City, UT) in Apr 2012

Interview Questions: How much experience I had with Exchange, apparently they do not have much.

title: Student Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Indianapolis, IN) in Aug 2011

title: Enrollment Counselor Interview

Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Mentor - Faculty Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Western Governors University (Indianapolis, IN) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: The first call was with a recruiter who did a quick phone interview and let you know when you could expect a phone call for your next interview on a particular day. The second phone interview is with a manager in that department area (this may not be your actual manager once hired) and you are asked situational interview questions. The ones that start with, "Tell me about a time when you have had to...."  So review your past roles and think of times when you've handled challenging aspects well.
Interview Questions: There no unexpected questions. Because you work from home they are looking for how well you self-manage and deal with issues as they arise. So be prepared for that.

title: Assessment Editor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Western Governors University (Salt Lake City, UT) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed twice, both telephone interviews.  The interviews went smoothly.  It was the waiting afterward that was frustrating.  What I was told would be a two-week wait turned into a month, and then four months.  I called after the first two weeks and then after the first month and a half and was told to "be patient."  I was about to accept another offer when they finally called and offered me the job.
Interview Questions: WGU likes to know that you know their competency-based education philosophy.  I would recommend that anyone apply to a position there familiarize themselves with competency-based education.
